reviewText:
One of the greatest (if not the greatest) free mmorpg right now for several reasons imho. I will give you my pros and cons and keep in mind that this is an ANIME mmorpg , i know that not every1 likes animes but i love them and based on my experience i ll assume that to be in the pros category ! :)

PROS :

- It is FREE , you can become great without even spending a single euro/dollar !
- Anime graphics , well designed world and characters !
- New player friendly , anyone can learn all he needs to know from the in-game tutorials which are all implemented in the story-line and are presented at the proper time.
- Nice storyline that will keep you interested (if you are ever read missions and not skip them)
- Clever way to involve pets (named eidolons in the game) in the storyline and awesome system to get them gathering key fragments. (pets and mounts are different)
- A big variety of classes and the abillity to choose a subclass at later levels allows for many different playstyles and combinations !
- Fishing , digging and other extra stuff to keep you busy even when you think you are done leveling up (you ll never actually be :P ).
- Nice and friendly community, you can surely make a lot of in-game friends and have fun in the game !
- Quests offer an autopath for the monsters you have to slain or the things you have to find so you wont need to blindly search for them.


CONS :

- For those who skip missions it will be boring as it doesnt offer anything more in leveling up other than grind and more grind.
- There are not TOO many dungeons , you will have to repeat some of them at certain points which you may find tiring.
- Lags and glitches do exist but they are not unbearable , considering that the game is still young they shouldnt be a problem that will last for long.
- IF you decide to buy something with real money you need to know that things in the store are TOO expensive.
- Still in progress so the game still doesn't offer an ending at it's story line , it will be released at a later date.

RESULT :

As you can see : PROS >> CONS and overall this is a GREAT mmorpg that i strongly recommend to every single gamer out there , either you are a fan of mmorpgs or not ! It will keep you playing for hours and you will have a great time ! Awesome game , awesome kingdom ! :)

reviewText:
I played many hours of this game before it came to Steam. It's not the perfect MMO and it caters to a specific demo, I would recommend it based on the fact that is is free to try and worth a look.

Pros
- Beautiful world. The enviroments and the animals look like hand drawn anime.. the good kind. Not the cheesy cliche kind
- Very populated with a (usually) friendly player base.
- I thought I had to pay for the scarf around level 20 to continue the main quest line but apparently I did not need to. I think they make that a bit confusing on purpose. Other than that the F2P model is pretty good.
- Very easy to understand and pick up and play. Nothing is overly complex and the UI and all other things surrounding gameplay make sense.

Cons
- The million dollar MMORPG word.. grindy. The game is VERY kill 10 of these and collect 8 of these. They throw some curveballs in there occasionally but this is what ultimately had me stop playing in the 40s. It just stopped being fun.
- Dungeons are repetitive cut and paste. Nothing special there for sure.
- Didn't care for the music so I put my own ambient soundtrack to it.
- Easy. This could go under pro or con. I didn't mind it but some will.

Aside from dueling I never got too much into PvP in this game so I can't really speak on that. Each class seems pretty cool and you get to pick a secondary skill along the way which helps keep combat fresh. The battle companions are cool but can get annoying with the constant dialogue thing.

Overall I'm happy with the time I put into it. I'm sure it gets more fun when you are at or close to cap but I could not continue any longer. You can check out my video review in my First Impression/Final Impression videos below. Enjoy!

http://youtu.be/tga-W9MJA7M

http://youtu.be/tCY8VB6Nzfc

reviewText:
i played this game before it was released on steam and i reached a level 42 character after a week of on and off gaming.
i gotta say i really enjoyed my time with it. im gonna show a list of  pro's and con's of this game just to shorten this out and give my own overall opinion of the game.

pro's

1. its a free MMO

2. the anime design and texture quality is pretty good compared to other titles. also pretty unique

3. has many graphical opions for a wide array of systems

4. no mana - very well done cooldown combat system with quite smooth movement. ( not perfect movement but good for what it is)

5. very large areas and a arrray of monsters to fight and quests to complete

6. ALSO COULD BE CON! simple 1 click quest navigation allowing you to quickly get to a quest location without having to hunt for its location

7.  has a great starting area and not as dull and lengthy as other starter areas.

CON'S
1.  ALSO COULD BE PRO! simple 1 click quest navigation. for those who like to explore and find what you need with a group this could ruin the experience

2. very specific audience if you dont like the asthetic of anime or cartoon look then this wont be for you

3. camera can be a hassle when playing for the first time and no real lock on system. would help those who cant multitask as well as others with controls

4. after a while it can be a grind to complete certian quests if they are repeated quests.

5. can be quite easy and no really challenge if your fighting at low levels. even at higher levels you can do most of the questing alone without a group.

6.PRO/CON: certian dungeons require a group to complete allowing more co-op opportunites or a hassle if you wish to play alone
7. in certian areas and certian times. it can strain your system and according to other users. runs porrly on certian compontents ( be sure what your pc parts are and any issues with them and the game before playing if you wish to avoid problems out the game)

for me i really enjoyed this game. alone and in the company of random people in those specific dungeons. there is no hostility and is just a blast to play for a few minutes to a few hours. i also really like this games art design and the character design ( even though there is clearly fan service) overall i would recommend you give this game a solid try and see if you enjoy it. if you like numbers on a scale i give it a 8/10  not perfect but worth a try if this game has your interest

reviewText:
Aura Kingdom is a fantasy anime-style MMORPG that has the player take on the role of an 'Envoy of Gaia' - a human with abilities far exceeding those of all but other Envoys. Every player is given three Eidolons throughout the story, NPC companions each with their own unique set of abilities, stats, and even personality.

The gameplay of Aura Kingdom is fairly repetitive, with hundreds of kill __ of __ and gather __ of __ quests. There is also very little 'multiplayer' as far as MMOs go. One could potentially complete every quest alongside friends rather easily, but there is little merit to doing so other than the obvious social benefits. Armour grants you stats and costumes grant minor benefits and the visual appeal. While this somewhat stifles players' creativity in creating costumes from inexpensive armours, you will also never have to walk around in a barrel. Everything is stylish and fits someone's tastes.

The level cap set at 65 (correct me if I'm wrong) the grind to 40 goes smoothly enough, with quests being the best source of EXP around. Monsters grant players VERY little EXP, usually below .15% per.

Now here's the catch; this game can be quite addicting when played with friends, and there is always a fresh, shiny new set of armours and weapons waiting for you at every level milestone. Despite being an MMO, this game holds plenty of replayability to try out each class, skillsets, and offensive/defensive point spreads.

I would recommend this game to anyone looking for a casual game to goof around in with friends.

Disclaimer This game may contain panty shots. Select costumes with care.

reviewText:
REVIEW BREAKDOWN
In this review, I will be breaking it down to four different categories:
-Community / Playerbase
-Gameplay
-Money System
-Overall thoughts/experience
Oh, and there will be a TL;DR at the bottom as well.


Community
Aura Kingdom's community throughout my experience was not exceptionally bad, although it isn't what I would consider good either. In AK, the majority of players are quiet, there are very few conversations going on in even the main cities/zones in the game unless it is due to a quest and/or event where partying is required. This issue may be due to the fact that Aeria Games, or rather, Aura Kingdom specifically is having a 'bot' problem making players (including me) feel less engaged into the world.

Gameplay
Even though Aura Kingdom uses the standard MMORPG controls (who some may not prefer), the game itself was very enjoyable, the animation in each classes abilities were stunning and beautiful. Mobs and monsters in this game were each unique but some displayed the same attack patterns making it feel slightly repetititve. Also take note that AK is a extremely easy game until near endgame (lvl 60+) as well as the fact that once you DO reach endgame it is extremely slow to level which may make it feel boring due to lack of effort needed or fatigue. Overall, it uses a nicely executed combat system but Aeria Games may want to take a step up on the early difficulty.

Money System
So, is Aura Kingdom Pay to win or not? The answer is no, heres why;
Although Aeria Games advertise themselves quite heavily as you play through, all you can really buy with the real money content are rare items or ruby coins which can be used to sell for in-game currency, gold. The rare items (such as costumes) changes your stats very insignificantly and is not different to those stats of a free costume that is earned through questing. Sure, you can buy gear with that gold you earned from spending your real money but in the end, most gear in Aura Kingdom isn't very expensive and can be earned fairly fast without even having to spend a penny on the game. I have experience on both my characters, one which I spent money on and the other I didn't, although they are different classes there aren't much difference in strength, at least not enough for me to consider Aura Kingdom pay to win.

Overall
Aura Kingdom is a fun and entertaining game, it may not suit everyone but it definitely kept me satisfied with everything it is and will continue to for a long while, I have shared a lot of fun memories with my friends and people I have met on this game and although the community is fairly quiet once you find the right people, it will make the game feel so much more engaging and lively. If I were to give Aura Kingdom a rating, it would be a 8/10.

TL;DR: Aura Kingdom is a fun and entertaining game to play but has its own fair share of problems such as bots and being too easy. It is not pay to win.

*BRIEF EDIT (2/4/2015)*
This may hinder the gameplay for some and was worth mentioning, Aeria Games does a fairly poor job in terms of management when it comes to Aura Kingdom, lack of updates, unorganized events, etc.

The game is a great casual MMO. I played a lot of this off of Aeria Ignite, not Steam. So excuse my hours.

However, they had a server merge. Despite being logged in recently; I logged on to see all of my characters were wiped. I had 2 max levels and they both had premium currency purchased content, and now they are gone.

If you're new to this game, you're probably going to like it. But if you played before and were on one of the two servers that underwent the merge... you probably lost your stuff, and you're angry like I am.

I'll probably never come back to this game. This is an inexcusable bug.

reviewText:
In general I have two things to say about this game:

* it's nice looking anime-styled and not oversexualized game;

* it turns incredibly boring when you get to level 55.

I managed to crawl to level 66 btw and raised a few alts to 50-55… just for more grind.

~~~
TL;DR: If you like anime and repetitive grind - this game is for you. If you only like anime then try to enjoy the story during your quest to The Level 55 great barrier. Don't forget to make a few screenshots of rich players at Navea when you get there. Then kill it with fire before it became too boring to play.
~~~

Unfortunately, this game has almost no quests which you may want to bother to read and the vast majority of them are mundane kill and fedex. There are a couple of oddballs, but they are rare and clunky. They don't feel like they belong here. After level 55 it's non-stop grindfest and repeating of the same dungeons over and over again. Every single day. Especially if you want to get some rare Eidolons. Every 5-10 levels a few new" areas will open for you. Did I say "new"? I meant you will be revisiting the same areas with different enemies on your way. Due to that game looks cheap. All locations in the game are small
recommended: and reused on every possible occasion. It's especially easy to see in the daily fame quests. The game pulls 5 random quests out of 40 every day for you
hoursPlayed: but there are only 5 or 6 different maps! You just start from a different point and different enemies may crawl around (fixed for each quest). Even "urgent" event quests reuse the same maps! Near the end of 2014 they added guild dungeon system and you think what? They've reused existing maps again! They just placed invisible walls around some spots on the low-level maps and called them dungeons. You can even get out of these areas by jumping and walk through empty from players and NPCs versions of low-level villages.\n\nYet another massive fun-stopper in this game is exploration part. Collision boxes for many world objects are just wrong. They stop you from flying over the small bumps

They don't exist where you expect them to be or just much less detailed and stands far from the visible object boundaries. See that chimney? Jump on top of... 1 meter above the chimney invisible floor. See that roof? Oh wait we are in the house now. In an odd way. You can glide to traverse locations faster

You just click on the quest objectives to get to the location and repeating the same attack pattern like a bot. Why? Just to get through the next area and reach a higher level.

Ah

reviewText:
If you liked Forsaken World or Perfect World International (PWI) (in some ways even Battle of the Immortals/War of the Immortals) then you will like this game, it plays a lot like them with various improvements and it may even be the same game engine. Single click auto-pathing for quests, lots of unique little things to participate in, ability to skip quest dialog, full featured minimap will click to move, no need to loot after monster kills, etc. The user interface is refined and has a lot of nice little features not seen in the larger MMOs. The improvements make the game easy to understand and play.

The game is definately targeted for the casual player. It has nice graphics and sound, but a lot of the improvements are focused around making the game fast and easy to play. Unlike so many other MMOs, you get a mount very early on. You should be level 10 and have one toolbar of skills, a mount, and your companion, within an hour or two of starting the game.

You get to choose your companion when you create your character, and there are seven different choices. Each one has different skills and focuses - one may be a healer and another a warrior type. The companion is similar in functionality to SWTOR companions, but you can even have little conversations with them.

You gain new skills (based on the class you choose) as you level automatically, and you have character improvement tileset. You gain one improvement point every three levels. I call it a tileset because its not a tree, your starting point is in the middle of all of the tiles and you can pick improvement tiles moving outward in any direction.

The in game store items seem a little expensive compared to other games. They have plenty of various cheap or expensive items, but just for comparison: 75 cents for a 20% xp boost for 60 minutes, $5 for a 20% xp boost for 24 hours play time (24 hours of played time, not calendar time so it will last multiple days), $50 for a unique mount that is 60% movement speed, if you buy 4 of them you can combine them into a 90% mount. For $15 you can get an item that gives you a 24 hours of 50%/25% monster/quest xp boost. I like the play time versus day time system, because it discourages afks and it is aimed at the casual player who might play one or two days a week. So if you play around 5 or 6 hours a week, the $15 boost will last you about a month.

You can purchase XP books from the store that instantly give amounts of XP, 29 cents for a book that gives the equivalent of 20 monster kills of your level. You can buy the in-game cash shop currency in $5, $10, $25 etc increments. They also have spending tier" rewards per month
date: as you reach higher tiers you get greater free rewards. The first two spending tiers are at $5 and $15. Purchases go through the Steam Store so you don't have to visit another website.\n\nOverall it is a very refined game with a lot of features and a better UI that is not found in today's larger MMOs. The cash shop is optional but the enticement to buy XP outright
recommended: or buy timed XP boosts will always be tempting - but "free" games are not free to build and run by the companies that make them and they need to make a profit."

reviewText:
This MMORPG is polished, and fun
Even though I'm in China, the server has fast response and little lag
The game is generally fun
However there're two main problems:
-First, it is not fully voiced, your character is completely slient so there's basically nothing to hear other than repeating BGMs and stupid SEs.
-The other problem is the one that almost haunting every MMORPG on the internet: BOTs
It's not only making the game unfair due to the great inflation caused by currency pouring inside the market gained via using Bot, but also make our life miserable-game provider thinks it's a great idea to make lvl30 tradable so they can block Bots from trading. THEY ARE SO WRONG. BOTs don't really care, but WE DO.
We are suffering from this stupid policy and have to level up like no tomorrow
According to my experince, I spent 11 hours to reach lvl 31. So basically the first 10 hours of gaming you are prevented from any kinds of trade, period.

But the characters do look cute, and that's all i really care about.

reviewText:
My experience from this game goes as such: Community basis, is very accepting, and kind. You can join a raidcall and within a minutes make friends. In the actual game you do busy work until level 60 where you can finally start to do something entertaining. However, after 65, the leveling gap really becomes apparent. at level 70, an entire run of dungeons gets you roughly 1 percent of your current level and less so the higher the level. Also with the rarity of the drops. You either have luck, or stop playing you are waisting time. This game is based on luck on time. If you don't have both of those, don't play. 124.3 hours in game in the past two weeks got me nothing of use from dungeons, high level monsters, high level anything.

Now that my rant is over, in all seriousness:
Pros:
Very friendly community
Weekly updates
Teamwork oriented

Cons:
Very time consuming
Very luck based (you need to be very lucky)
Progessively large xp and level gaps (One size fits all)
Foot in the door type currency systems (difficult to make money, items are usually very expensive, unless you have a sugar momma/daddy, refer to Cons 1 & 2)
Very difficult to get level up armour and weapons (Cons 1, 2 & 3)

reviewText:
Graphics: 10/10
The graphics are by far the best part of the game in my opinion. The game looks lush and explorable. At times more explorable than it actually is. It looks like you really CAN go more than two minutes into the ocean without bumping into an invisible wall! (of course you can't though, the invisible wall is very much there. ;D) Each place looks unique and beautiful.
I'm in love with the style as well. Anime styles can often go wrong, especially in games, but this one is the good kind of anime, not the cheesy kind. The characters are cute and vibrant, and just look plain good.
There is a lot of eye candy here!

Customization: 8/10
The customization at the beginning of the game is average. 10 or so hair choices and eye choices with colors to go along with them. You can choose your class (all of them play very similarly by the way) and skin color. The classes aren't gender locked which I liked very much.
I would have liked to have sliders for things such as height, weight, and length of hair. If you'd like a shorter or chubbier character you're out of luck. I also would have liked to be able to choose the bangs and back of hair seperate. There are many hair styles that I only liked the front or back of.
You are going to look cute no matter what you choose but it could use some more options. You will find characters that look just like you.

Gameplay: 5/10
This is where the game goes wrong. I've heard it was too easy, but I didn't think I would mind. I've enjoyed plenty of easy games, such as Kirby and Pokemon but this isn't just the 'leveling up too fast' easy. This is the 'holding your hand throughout the entire game' easy. You can literally press a button for any quest and be guided to wherever you need to go without moving your character at all. The character is drawn by a shining path and you can just sit back, relax, have a soda, and watch your character move for you. Kind of ruins the point of a game"

reviewText:
Product received for free

By Far Aura Kingdom is top notch towards its gameplay, community and of course, its material of how it works by buying stuff and what gives towards Free2Play players.

Pros:True Free2Play material
Amazing landscapes and graphics for its release date ( December 23, 2013 )
Great artwork towards its fighting styles and gameplay
Auto pathing quest mechanic
Reasonable UI and full editable
Plenty of settings ( UI / Chat Font Scaling, System settings to free up memory, Video/Audio settings, Change button/keyboard/mouse layout config )
Really good typical MMO combat system ( tab targeting )
13 Classes to choose from
You can play with 2 different classes on your main character ( Required 43 Level Quest to Navea to get your next class )
Plenty of areas to explore
No noticeable server lag
Funny and amazing community
Dev Team feedback is outstanding ( Yes i talked to them for about 15 huge posts so far! )
Free DLC!: http://store.steampowered.com/app/282201/
Cons: Not much group love ( No share quests, No do same quests but both to get the items of the specified quests, Loot options non existent. )
Some quests are a bit confusing as they have no ways to know where to actually go or do what
5 Quest limit that you can take! >.<
Pvping is not the focused spot of this game ( if you like PVP much ) could have gotten more love!
No voice acting or player gestures having any sounds ( laughing sound, cheer sound, general gesture sounds ) should give some love aswell!
Optional Comments:
Unknown Reason of Banned Accounts:  Billing Inactivity "

Some people curse/swear towards Aeria Games about its ways acting upon inactive accounts that they getting banned for biling inactivity after a while ago if you haven't played their game/'s
date: while it actually is for your own protection that they delete your char temporary for hackers to not do anything towards him/her.\n\nIf
recommended:
you contact support they will bring him/her back ASAP. The reason they put 'billing inactivity' is because they don't have updated just yet their reasons to be more clear towards us and it needs time to get updated :P

Dev Message:Then i gone to ask about those negative reviews about the billing inactivity reasons and thats what they told me:
About the numerous negative Steam reviews. You may or may not be aware that we ban accounts for inactivity in order to protect them from unauthorized access. However
hoursPlayed: many of our ex-players don't know that and they think that they're getting banned because they're not purchasing AP (the ban message says the reason is "billing inactivity"). Instead of contacting us
voteText: so we can remove their bans they choose to badmouth us wherever they can. I don't think that our ban policy will change soon
helpfulPercent: but we will look for ways to inform them better about their ban situation.\nEnd of Line / Last Thoughts:\nThe game might get boring for some and repetitive

reviewText:
After 300 hours (now reaching 900 hours) of gameplay, I decided to write this review. I'm enjoying this game, nice and addictive MMO, but feels boring sometimes. Here's the point.

Pros :
- Nice anime style. It's cute btw.
- There's a loli waiting for you.
- Not-so-really Pay to Win, IMO.
- Loyalty Point, which let you buy items from the item mall.

Cons :
- Bot, bot, bot, bot, bot, bot, and bot.
- Repetitive quest. (Well, it's a MMO, so don't expect too much about it.)
- Too grindy.
- Monsters, some dungeons and some weapons were copy-paste and the only difference is their colors.
- And more bots for you.

Neutral :
- The soundtrack is good, but a bit repetitive.
- Community is so.. err.. quiet? Though I don't really care because there's no spamming chat, this is may be a problem for new players to ask something about the game. But don't worry, just ask in the trade channel, they will answer you. Or find and join an active + friendly guild.

My personal rating? 8.5/10. Do I recommend this to you? Yes, give it a shot, at least.

reviewText:
I played the game since over 1 week and have 2 chars over level 50 and i tested all the 10 (11 after a patch) classes in the first 30-40 levels and i know that i play this game very long time in this 1 week.
So i think i can give a early review with a enough experience for it.
It´s your choice to play the game or to let it be but i want to help you with your choice with a pro-neutral-contra-list.

Pro: -10 classes they are feels diffrent and all feels good playable. (i tested all the first 30-40 levels)
-after level 40 (i think it was 40 but it can be a little bit more or less) you can choice a second class for combine it to create your playstyle
-2-3 classes from this are better for each first class because you become 3 extra skills from the combination but you can play every class with every class you want (not the second class as first class... i mean you can´t play with bow and bow or something)
-good balanced skill-cooldowns
-you can dodge heavy attacks with movement! (it´s not to hard)
-the community is good (i didn´t read a lot of flame or other bad stuff in chat like in other MMORPGs)... i don´t speak from the steamcommunity because i only have the experience from before this game was on steam
-I like the petsystem (pets are called eidolons) because they are very usefull for fighting/buffs/healing and you can upgrade they
-You can play the game and watch Videos in high quality or other things at the same time because the game don´t need a lot of ressources from hardware (at maximum settings) and you don´t need a good internet to play it without laggs
-You can become with quests/loot/buy in shops a lot of dekoration items for your character (on the left side at the top from the minimap you can find a boosymbol, click on that and you can search all dekorationitems, eidolons[pets] or other items and you can see how they look)
-groupfinder for dungeons (this made it easy to find a group for a dungeon)
-you can find a list of events at a symbol near the minimap and with that you can see at wich time you can join a event

reviewText:
I've played dozens of Anime stlye MMO's over the years, and some are similar, some are different. What usually defines how that game is not like all the others tends to usually fall into one major gimmick per game.

In Aura Kingdom that would be known as the 'Eidolon' system.

Basically it's your own pet that fights with you. They're core in the game and are not too hard to obtain.

(This review is based on a few things. I have two characters. One lvl 50 and one level 30. I have yet to do the more 'lategame' stuff like high level dungeons. As of this review I've clocked around 40 hours.)

The main points of the game, you decide if it's good or bad.

- Quests are heavy and pretty much constant till you hit lvl 48. There is no monster grinding whatsoever and leveling is fast.
- Even though there are parties, questing is pretty much a solo thing and instances need to be done solo.
- The classes and skills are quite different and unique.
- Appearance is based on global costumes rather than class related armor.
- There seems to be class imbalances at the current time of the game. So far my Ravager (which is considered more AoE) has bested duelists of my level.
- There is no MP (as far as I can tell) in the game, letting mages spam.
- There is a need to kite enemy spells as they can be dodged by movement and skills, meaning there is a bit more skill in some mob fighting.
- All classes, even the support types like Bard are capable of solo questing and don't need to depend on parties.
- Gaining decent items at earlier levels is not too hard provided you know your way around the market and auction area.
- Mobs spawn back really fast so dont worry about AoE mob stealers or KSers.
- Gaining 'Bonus EXP' is fairly simple with parties. EXP is not split between members however - making Power Leveling unapparent.
- There is quite a number of bots who auto follow quests since going from place to place is REALLY easy.
- High number of 'grindy' collection quests which require this or that killed/collected. This is countered by the decent drop rate. Seems to be around 60%.To collect 5 eggs from birds you usually have to kill around 10 or less.
- Eidolons are quite handy in a solo game like this. They're easy to level up.
- You can glide.
- Characters have very little stats to customise due to lack of MP related stats.
- Subclasses can be obtained to make your character even more unique.
- There are tons of daily and hidden quests for you to find if you really want to.
- There is an achievement system for those who like to collect.

A review of the basics:
-Very story driven.
-Leveling is easy.
-Classes are unique.
-Easy to understand GUI.
-Easy quest system.
-More of a solo-ish game.

My personal experience:
Got to level 40 on my first day because I have no life. Made a guild with my real life friends. There wasn't much interaction till 1 daily quest and there still isnt. It's been 5 days and I only just got to level 50. Im slowly starting to get bored of the monotony now, at this level there are around 10 quests of collection and killing ♥♥♥♥ and you don't even ge to the next level. I'm gerenally a fickle person with my MMOs, I play things until there's too much repetition because I don't have the patience for that and the novelty of the game wears off when that happens.

My Ravager makes quick work of nearly all mobs and I dont require the use of a potion due to my innate tankiness and the fact I have a DMG/CRIT type. The only problem I face is soloing boss monsters which tend to mow me down quite fast and actual skill is required to kill them though kiting (which is a good thing). My sorcerer pretty much is a spam machine that doesn't even compare to my Ravager.


Based on:
40 hours, 2 characters (50, 30), Ronin patch.

Verdict:
Worth a shot for anyone into MMORPGs, especially for those trying to learn it. the quest tracker makes lives simple for those learning about these type of games and all NPC chat doesn't need to be read to know what's going on.

For more reviews check out my website:
Explicitly Honest.[www.explicitlyhonest.com]

reviewText:
Decent game but don't put your real money into it.

Getting from start to level 60 is possible within a couple days; leisurely playing. 65 and up is a repeatative grind. More things unlock at 66, 70, 75, 76, and so forth in this pattern.

The Eidolons are cool looking but are weak unless you can manage to get literally every form of buff for them; 3 star evolution, 3 star their wish requirements, strong accessories. The best eidolons are often requiring real money to get, or a lot of work in game to even attempt towards getting before that eidolong related item becomes unavailable again.

Sky Tower is basically only way to get certain items and those require a good raiding team. Join a popular guild, and that's basically your only hope of getting said items.

The community is on all ends of the spectrum, but the worst are the loli lovers or open pedo's. Have meet a few normal people from the game but it's like needle in a haystack of finding them.

Overall: 7/10
They could do better and it's more clear of that the longer that you play. Mainly community management needs improving, the market needs leveled out from pay to win, and could fix the leveling system for higher levels past 65. Won't invest my real money until things are improved.

reviewText:
If you have all the time in the world to grind faster than 10 bots(that is doens't have to rest), this game is for you. If you can read Trad chinese go play on the Taiwan servers, US servers are unbearable to say the least.

The review will be for the US servers.

Servers are very laggy if your not near or in the US. 1 ~ 10 minute delays if you dont disconnect. as of 12/12/15. Peak hours (for bots) you can't interact with npcs tp gates etc for about 10 ~ 30mins. Server merges only worsened the problem, this only further caused the low player base to decay.

I play this from the launcher rather than from steam, I can say i have at least 2k hours on the game.

Aeria games is just a failure in game management, it has come to the point that people that love the game (for its art style) looks for bugs in the game. Meanwhile Aeria is just sitting there waiting for XLegends to do everything for them. If only this game came out under another company, it would have had a bright future ahead of it.

1 Prime example is failure to uphold its founder pack promises, they were not cheap. The handful of founders left still playing are also leaving due to this. As a company they will try to squeeze every penny they can from you, once they do they just toss you aside, in this case it was the founders. After they paid $550, with the uncertainty the game will even make it through to release, their exclusive content is now being released to non-founders for free. Other physical contents were unable to be given to the players, AG then tried to sweep it under the rug by giving players conpensation ingame.

RNG in game is like entering a lottery for a trillion dollars. They try to use that as a way of enticing players to spend real money(for boosters that do jack all), meanwhile this pertpetuates the botting problem as buying gold from bots are WAAAYYYY~ cheaper and you 100% get the item. Thus the cycle continues with rarer and rarer drops while bots get more and more revenue to continue botting.

Player to bots ratio? About 1 : 3. If you take the fact that most players have 5+ characters you can basically take the ratio down to a 1 : 10.

Content between lvl 1 ~ 50 is basically a SP game with 1 daily multi-player dungeon worth doing, takes 2 mins. Gear doesn't  matter.
Content between lvl 50 ~ 66 is paced nicely with reasonable grinding times to lvl and gain items. Gears start to matter.
Content between lvl 66 ~ 70, phew, grindy to say the least. Gears is the key to be able to do party dungeons.
Content from lvl 70 onwards, its world record grind fest with RNG that is basically non-existent. Don't expect to make it into a party for dungeons in this lvl range unless you have end game gears. Back to being an SP game except now theres not even a story, as the gap between quests get bigger there is less to nothing that keeps the player going, other than the thread of hope that they might win the lottery.

You basically cannot reach the end game stage without spending most of your time on the game (6 characters doing all the dungeons every 3 hrs impossible to do all the ones that reset, across the span of a half a year to say the least), playing merchant for about half a year if your lucky, buying gold from bots, or buying AP (Aeria Points) with real money. Paragon table a lottery table where you roll items, is nicknamed the scam table. People have spent 500k RC (each roll is 200RC) on it and failed to obtain anything aside from junk and emeralds. Emeralds let you roll at the table some more, the results are similar to the ones using RC.

If your new to the MMORPG style, try TERA the RNG is acutally reasonable and it has an awesome auto match making function for dungeons that balances your team.

Main reason people play this is for the anime like art style, Eidolons (grindfest v 1.1) unique art style, nothing noteable other than that. Sad to see a game with such a unique art style die because it landed in the hands of a worthless company.

reviewText:
It's a pretty solid MMORPG, but it could use some work.

PROS:
Graphics - Pretty adorable little anime graphics, everything is well modeled, especially for an MMO.
Quests - If you do the quests, there's a fairly minimum outside grind needed, but of course it's faster just to grind, if you know the right places.
Storyline - Unlike many other Anime-style RPGs, the story is very scarcely cringy.
Character Options - There are numerous character options. First, you start out with a class (really just a weapon, but y'know), and a follower called an Eidolon. As you progress through the game, you can improve your starting Eidolon, or get ones that are way better. Each one has different skills and interacts with your character in various ways. At lvl 50, you can choose a second weapon, either one that makes your character way better at the niche that it has, or one that rounds it out better.

CONS:
Staffing - Pretty nil. Oftentimes, the serious reports aren't handled for a long time, while most things minor that happen when a staff is on will get handled right away, resulting in a ban. However, unlike most of the top reviews say, you won't likely get banned for the stupid stuff they say you are unless you are just doing it right in front of a mod, which is overall stupid.
PvP - The game is advertised as PvE, and it really lives up to that. But if you like PvP, then you might be dissapointed by this game.

TL;DR Good game, has good graphics and a decent story, but some of the people aspects could use some work.

reviewText:
This game is cute and you get to pick a cute anime girl fairy who aid you in combat and gets treasure for you once in a while. Very cute anime game and all, but incredibly unpolished and unbalanced.

You are incredibly overpowered against any normal enemy around your level, mostly because you get so powerful equipment really fast, much of it from area bosses you can easily solo. These respawn in just minutes and there are several of them even in the starting area. The drops are not level based either. I got some boots with a level requirement of 40 in a lvl 1 -> 10 zone, and several other pieces for players around lvl 15-20. It makes no sense!

MANY quests seem broken or not even implemented. Where the quest text should be you have either nothing or just a string of numbers. I don't know if they can be completed, but how you would do so without ANY info whatsoever beyond me.

It's cute, and although it seemed stable it is horribly unfinished. Don't play this, watch K-On! instead for cute.

reviewText: Aura Kingdom is almost a caricature or a deconstruction of the whole concept of a Massive Online JRPG. The character designs immediately call to mind Magic Knight Rayearth; fashion is pretty and elaborate with lots of frills on display, hair is long and available in a variety of fanciful colors, and all swords are huge. Combat is pretty easy to learn, each weapon type has some kind of small gimmick that helps to keep squashing the various adorable monsters roaming the world from becoming stale quickly. A similarly easy to learn fishing mini-game is also worked in, with its own equipment and interface. Cosmetic gear is entirely seperated from statistic-granting combat gear, leading to the situation whereby your character can look like pretty much whatever you want without impacting the ability to fight effectively.\nThis is the kind of game where there's no dungeon finder, but 14 seperate dance emotes. Where new abilities are learned automatically on level up or are chosen for free, straight from the character info window, and are re-chosen with fairly minimal penalty the same way. It's a very soothing kind of game, great for mellow, casual players or people just getting acquainted with online games.\n...In summary, if you spend most of your time foaming at the mouth and screaming into a headset mic about why your last raid wipe or lost ranked match was everyone else's fault, give this one a pass. Try chewing on some wood instead.

reviewText:
Alright, this is going to be a decently detailed review so bear with me here.

For a TL;DR version: This game is a fun yet grindy instance-based themepark MMO. You will not enjoy this at all if you dislike any of the aforementioned.

I have a love-hate relationship with this game. I have been playing since Chimera server release, and at first loved it dearly, as it was one of my first actual MMOs. Also, it was after watching Sword Art Online, which got me into this binge" feeling for MMORPGs. Any new player to the MMORPG scene would probably enjoy this game a lot
date:
as it provides a general experience of an MMORPG.


Pros:Very friendly to newcomers. There are tutorials for just about everything - but oh sweet jeebuz
recommended:
the voices.
Graphics are beautiful; if you're into anime-styled characters with big boobs and badass swords - you'll probably enjoy this game.
Many classes to choose from - you'll never get bored from the multitude of choices. I have levelled many characters to a certain point (50-60) and have enjoyed all but one.
Sub-classes: Some MMORPGs do not provide this experience. You will use two classes as your setup
hoursPlayed: but can be hard deciding if you have never played the other classes
voteText: as there is such a wide variety.\nThe first time through the game is crazy - it can be hard keeping up with all the skills you're offered

reviewText:
Pros:
Cutesy anime-style
Fast, neat-looking skills and lush, beautiful graphics
Good soundtrack for most maps

(ﾉ◕ヮ◕)ﾉ*:･ﾟ✧ Is F2P
Many chances for gaining better items, or even costumes and mounts.
Has opportunities for both PvP and PvE oriented people

Guild customization and flexibility
Moderate-high player base
Nice overall community (when not agitated by below reasons)
Cons:
Too many repeatable/non-unique/daily quests
Leveling gets painfully slow if you don't have enough boosters
Bots galore (very annoying for newbies and all levelers in general)
Is a grindfest after level 55
Can be too easy for some people (i.e. guided questing)
Storyline degrades overtime

Slow to release new content
Listening to the same soundtrack being repeated over and over again...
Item mall and costume-showoffs may discourage you from playing
Takes a while to get better eidolons and faster mounts are virtually unobtainable without paying (with some exceptions)

A ton of lag when entering the major city
Has a clunky UI that takes up too much unnecessary space
Servers are typically slower for EU players
My score: 3.5/10
Overall, my experience with this game was bad. I enjoyed it as a beginner and all, but what turned me off at the end was the lack of enthuiasm due to the slow leveling and bland repetitive questing. Heck, my main character barely reached level 60, and I'm sure that I will never get to level 80 without paying in bulk - nope, I don't want to go through all that sugar-coated hell all over again.

This game has potential for improvement though, so not all hope is lost.

reviewText: Updated review content: After finally getting to level 60 I have to change my review to do not recommend.  Leveling to 60 wasn't too bad, but as I saw in my original review below, nothing special.  The problem is at level 60 quests that were giving you 10-15% of a level each now give about 0.1%.  The solo dungeons available give less than 1% to run the entire thing.  Doing dailies with level 65 mobs that are quite painful to push through give about 3% for 30-60 minutes of work.  But unfun work.  I literally beat on the same enemy for 10 minutes straight to take him down and he was only PART of that quest requirement.  The only way to level is to run party dungeons, but parties don't take people below level 65.  The game does not get better.  All reports indicate level 70+ is even worse.  If it's just grind grind grind and solo grind at that until 65... forget it.  Not the point of an MMO.\n\nIt's a free to play MMO with decent graphics that doesn't seem to (I'm only mid 30s in level so far) nickle and dime you for every little think like so many other Asian free to play MMOs do.  There's nothing I've found exceedingly unique or special with this game than so many others.  It has nice convenience features like clicking a quest objective to take you there, easy party finding in most (low level at least) cases, and an active user base.  Again, shocked it doesn't nickle and dime.  There were a number of times I ran into in game things that were free I just KNEW would cost money, like item upgrading and inserting/removing stones that provide bonuses to items.  It's a good diversion for the price.  Nothing spectacular.

reviewText:
Normally I don't review games, normally I'm a pretty forgiving individual, but this one stood out as something that I kind of want to talk about.

This game classifies itself as a MMORPG but the way I see it is it's just Habbo Hotel in 3D. The party system in this game isn't even that as I've read on the Aeria forums from another player that states that it's just there as an item distribution system.

The gameplay mechanics are extremely simple but there is plenty of potential as it even allows you to hybridize the class system when you get to level 40. In fact it was that very idea that caught my attention (apart from the aesthetic appeal).

However, my grief with this game starts when in a party. You don't share EXP for each kill you get with the rest of your party and when doing quests side by side, a party member's achievements, like killing a monster, doesn't count to the rest of the party's quest count.

Someone please explain to me how games like this is still considered multiplayer? I look at this game and all I see is an online single player social game.

If you like the anime style gameplay and playing solo online then for sure go check this game out as it's visually appealing and again, the game system itself isn't that bad.

If you're looking for a massively multiplayer online role playing game? I wouldn't waste my time and bandwidth.

reviewText:
I've played this game since the very first day of Founders beta and I have no regrets. The graphics are pretty and it satisfies my costume addiction! I'd recommend this game to anyone looking for a casual game to play/wanting a temporary game while awaiting AAA titles.

Pros:
- Anime graphics: Weaboos' dream come true. They really are nice.
- Casual gameplay: There is a nice community in Crescent Hill ch1, who are really laid back and fun to be with. If you don't want to level up its so easy to make friends and laze about.
- Wide variety of costumes: If you're like me, this game will be perfect as you have lots of costumes to choose from and they can be dyed too.
- Easy to understand: The game's simplicity is another pro, it isn't like Perfect World International where you have to know the names of a tonne of things.

Cons:
- Publisher: Aeriagames is known for its not-so-good customer service so be warned, don't expect much and you probably will still be disappointed.
- Developer: X-Legend are the McDonalds' of MMORPGs so quality isn't really the thing going for it. If you've played Grand Fantasia or Eden Eternal, Aura Kingdom is really just a simpler and more visually appealing version of it.
- Patch times: They're not quick. Every few months we get a new large patch, IM promotions are much more frequent. Our next patch is scheduled for late February/early March so there is a long wait.
- Repetitiveness: You have solo challenge, solo, party and hell modes of all dungeons except the 3 dragons. It's really just reskinned versions of things (smartly named 'Otherworld' dungeons aka harder versions of lowbie dungeons) and gets old real fast.
- PvP: Don't even bother with it. Cash loads or fail.

Overall if you're looking for a bit of fun AKs the game for you. Hardcore players should avoid this game as the dungeon limits and stuff will inevitably get to them.

reviewText:
Yes this is gonna be a lengthy review of how awesome it is. No I will not put a TL;DR thing.

I was looking for a free mmorpg to play on Steam...you know something different, and this game exceeded my expectations.

Graphics:
The graphics are downright gorgeous. They put care into the designing of costumes and the characters expressing emotions. Now I know graphics can't only make the game, but I have to applaud them for the details they put into characters and the buildings. They really captured the anime feel of this game.

Customization of Character:
There are many customization options to choose from: Gender, Hairstyle, Hair Color, Eye Color, Face Style, and Skin Color. Regret your decision in the future? No problem. They sell a kit to help you change that. There are various costumes out there that you can use to customize what your character wears. You get free ones by completing the main story quest, but the rest you will have to buy with real money or loyalty points(points you earn while playing the game). Basically, your armor does not change the appearance of your character. There are costume slots such as headgear, body, and back.

Gameplay:
The gameplay is more action style and not slow turned based. The stats are allocated differently. There are three attack stats and three defense stats. The three attack stats are DMG,Crit,and SPD. The three defense ones are HP,DEF,and EVA. Each level later on, you gain one attack and one defense stat. Depending on your class and weapon, you can attack while you're turned around and while running. Did I mention you can glide in the air? Well you can! Did I mention they give you a starting mount? Well you get one! Did I mention EIGHT different classes? I know...*faint*

One key feature of the game is the game gives you a companion to use alongside your journey, more like a permanent two-person party. You have the option to summon or dismiss it whenever you like. At least you're not playing alone!

Story:
Fantasy and anime. The story is awesome so far for fantasy lovers. I could go on, but I think it's for the best to see it yourself.

List of things to do:
There are a ton of things. Hidden quests, achievements, and more where you can get different titles to boost your stats, or add some character to your character.

Economy:
Surprisingly with bots out there, the economy maintains its composure to be fair.

Customer Service:
They may ask you repetitive questions, but overall their service is kind and quick.

Overall, this game is the next big thing. This can beat all the free-to-play mmorpgs out there.

reviewText:
I've only been playing this game for a small time now, but from the moment I actually got into the game I noticed a few things that I want to note about this game. Of course this is a limited view as of right now, and I'll probably right more on this game in the future, but there are just things from a new player that I'd like to discuss that are appealing and absolutely not.

1. CAMERA DIRECTION. The camera is fixed, and not on the direction that your character is running, which is common in practically 99% of RPG games you and I could probably think of off the top of our heads. You have to hold down the right mouse button and manually steer around where your view is. This can be considered an infuriating experience at first. It also completely ruins the flow of the game, adventure, and just kinda sticks it more into your head that this is a program instead of your own cool anime adventure.

Even when it feels like I've gotten used to it, I end up in situations where this absolute design flaw sticks out like a sore thumb.

2. QUESTS OBJECTIVE TRACKING. While we're on the topic of that feeling of adventure that a lot of people would consider crucial for an RPG, myself included, the game has a function that can completely destroy the sense of adventure and exploration in quests. How? Well I'll start off by saying that any good RPG has a way to track the general destination or area that you have to go to for your quest, through just a little symbol that appears on the map or a symbol that appears generally on the top of the screen that points you where to go (note: in some games this can be executed poorly, however there are also games that can do this while still giving a lot of sense of adventure, Skyrim is a good example).

This game, however, has a pop-up screen that displays the goals of the quest, and if you click on the sentences of these obective (e.g you have to kill 5 of a certain enemy), the game will not only lay out a sparkly trail on the ground that not only leads to your goal, but also automatically starts taking you there. If you needed to find people that you can tell are supposed to be hard to find, you can just click this and you'll just be taken to them. More hidden resources that needed to be found? No worry, you'll be taken to it instantly.

For some, this is quite the positive, since a lot of people would find having to always look for the quest's objectives manually each time tedious and tiring; and it's a completely optional too. Honestly it's a pretty convenient function for people that just wanna blast through to get to the higher levels.

Although the bad thing I'll have to say about it is that the icon on the mini-map in the top right-hand of the screen the icons were absolutely confusing. There is a lot going on, and the icon that displays the direction of the quest does not stand out as much as the other symbols. The good thing is, however, that if you go into the regional map there is a list of icons on the side that not only tell you what each is for, but also has an option to not display them! Very handy.

I'd say these functions are honestly up to interpretation for whether they're good or bad. Personally, I find that it's very hard and not as clear as other RPG games in the showing of a more general direction and in frustration, can push you more to the option of just letting the game take you everywhere. I'm all about immersion and for me, even having that option takes away from the potential of the experience of adventure.

3. THE DESIGNS AND ITEMS. My god, everything is cool in this game. As an artist, aesthetics and the way colours and design catch the eye are very important to me for just about everything; especially in anything that's definitely more visual-based like games. But I've caught myself thinking quite a few times that it's overwhelming in this game, and even a bit 'too cool'.

Generally when we start to play a new fantasy MMORPG we start off with these kinda mediocre and mundane gear. In some you can see how it's kinda cool, but it's definitely not awe-inspiring. Especially compared to high-level players that you see running around mounted on something crazy like a lion with a fire mane, and gear on them that is radiating with some awesome aura, with wings coming out the ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ back. We look to these players and start to idolize them in a sense for looking so rad. And when you start to reach up closer to the top, and start to collect your own cooler items, you definitely start to get a sense of pride and accomplishment in the hard work you've put into developing your character so much, especially if you paid money for it.

This game off the bat gives you awesome items. For exmaple I choose the Scythe class for my first character, at a very early level I can summon not one, but THREE beautifully designed demons to accompany me; and the choice is out of six demons in total. Even if you didn't choose the Scythe class, under level 10 you are given a mount, which personally I've never witnessed in a fantasy MMORPG before.

And to top it all off, the game itself is actually based around the lore of it's world that there are these people chosen by destiny, that are given little creature companions (which is a very stereotypical thing to see in anime) that help you fight with their special abilities. While in character creation you get to choose out of four which one you want.

This trait in the game is also really up to interpretation just like the last one, too. On one hand, it's very rad that we all can have so many magnificent items, and can just look so fine. But on the other hand, it personally gives me less of an urgent want to progress fastly to be able to look good since I already am satisfied with my gear. Also on the more negative side, town centers were lots of players congregate can look completely ridiculous; like a hub for really over the top, overpowered original characters from deviantArt. And despite actually loving all the designs in this game, I still feel more neutral about it all.

4. LAG. The bane of all gamers out there, the insufferable force which destroys the natural flow and order in your gaming session - yes, ladies, gentlemen, and honoured guests - this game has so, so much lag. I don't believe I have to go into such extensive detail for this section, but it's so much that it DOES need to be noted. It's not so bad that it crashes my game or makes me lag for more then 10 seconds, but I do have a good laptop and internet.

Why so much lag though? Honestly, blame the dirty weabs. All there for the designs, I swear.

5. POP-UP CONVERSATION SCENES. In this game when you talk to anyone that isn't a background character a pop-up screen with your character's and the npc's top half of the body show up. Dialogue, actions each character makes shown in text, intervention from not only your first mount, but also your little companion that's always given to you... it's all just like a visual novel. And it's very appealing, and even refreshing and unique to see in a fantasy MMORGP.

It wouldn't be too much of a stretch that they put this in to appeal to those that are loyal anime fans, seeing as a lot of very popular games in Japan have these kinds of cut scenes that are very iconic in visual novels. They even give your character very over-exaggerated reactions that intergrate into the 'weaboo sub-popculture'.

I can imagine some people would find this cringe-worthy, but I doubt anyone that would see it like that would be interested in a blantantly obvious anime-inspired game in the first place.

6. CLASSES. I was going to write about this extensively, but I ran out of space, so here's the basics. There are a wide range of classes, up to 13 classes in total.

I'd recommend this game since most features that I see as note-worthy are more postive or up to interpretation, and therefore, worth giving a go and seeing if it's for yourself!

reviewText:
TL;DR - Game is awesome, has some pretty neat features. Leveling is fast, skills are flashy, players are many, IT'S NOT P2W but you'll probably spend cash anyways since the costumes and mounts are awesome and yeah, read below if you want to find out more.

I was a bit skeptical about this game at first since I read some stuff on the forums about it not receiving updates that often, devs being lazy and so on but I gave it a try nevertheless.
So far I'm loving it. Even if it's like your usual get that / do that type of MMORPG the art-style, graphics and gameplay are what keep me going with it. At the moment, I'm Lv16 and from what I see there are lots of features unlocking at Lv20 and Lv25.
Leveling is fairly easy, as of now I am leveling from like 3 quests which are easy to do, just go collect some things or kill some monsters.
The story is somewhat interesting, I don't usually read quest logs and stuff like that but this game made me read them. There are some cliche things here but still, compared to how other MMOs cough up story it's awesome.
This game has an interesting guild system as well. After you reach Lv10 you can join guilds by simply pressing G and searching for a guild that fits your liking. You instantly join them, no acceptance required. Now I'm not sure if this applies to every guild but still.
Another cool feature that I noticed is the friends system. It has this Intimacy thing which categorizes how close you are to your in-game friends. If you spend a lot of time with them in parties and stuff the Intimacy level goes up.
Skills are fancy, classes are awesome, mounts and the most important thing which I should have mentioned in the beginning, this game is not Pay-2-Win at all. At least from what info I managed to scrape so far.
As of now that's all I can say about this game, I highly recommend it to anyone that loves MMORPGs and doesn't mind anime-like graphics.
I'll update this once I get on a higher level and explore more of the content ! :)

EDIT : I am now Lv42 and I just chose my second class since you can get another class at Lv40 and pretty much combine skills and stuff. So far I'm still loving this game, even more than before and I also found myself a nice guild.
The dungeons are somewhat fun as well although I was used to dungeons like they were in WoW or CABAL Online but still, fun nevertheless. I also spent some cash on this after I learned about the Paragon Table thing (sort of like a gamble system where you can win costumes and stuff) so yeah.
I'll make another edit on this review once I progress even further in the content.

reviewText:
This is my first MMO and I’ve got to say i am impressed. Aura Kingdom is my all time favourite game and is the most played game in my library, you take on the role as a envoy of gaia –  a human with abilities far exceeding other humans. The envoy starts out as a regular human, working for a living, until a blue mysterious orb suddenly appears and follows the envoy around until transforming into its true form, an eidolon. After the public saw this they were reminded of a envoy like him who had supposedly gone crazy and hid in a cave this was because he had a desire for power and because of this his eidolon transformed into something sinister that caused the envoy to lose control and lash out at civilians. Because of this the envoy is scared that his destiny would end up like the other envoys destiny and would eventually go crazy, his solution, to use a ancient device to remove the eidolon before he loses control. There is more to the story but some prefer to find out for themselves.


Pros
-Beautiful world full of unique animals and creatures with an anime like visual style to it
-Populated servers with friendly people
-Free to play
-Easy to understand
-Dungeons are interesting to complete by yourself or in a party and will keep you interested
-Attention to detail is superb such as weapons, costumes, eidolons and mounts
-A amazing combat system with smooth transitions between moves
-Large areas full of quests and monsters to fight
-Gliding through the air is awesome
-Can run on crappy computers and crappy internet
-Good storyline if you don't continuously press the skip button
-Clever ways to involve companions (eidolon) which each have unique abilities, movesets, stats and even personalities (and there are many to choose from)
-Remains fun even if you have finished the main quest
-Pay to win doesn't really apply as long as you have perseverance
-Game has plenty of replayability like fishing, digging, creating new characters to use new classes and movesets, participating in the sky tower and events, duelling or trading with strangers, joining or creating dungeon raiding parties, side quests, hidden quests, achievements and more
-Game still receives updates so the game still has more to offer
-Many classes to choose from and you gain a secondary class at level 40 creating interesting combinations of movesets and combos
-Companions named eidolons are useful for fighting/buffs/healing and can be levelled up
-Has events which happen every 3 to 4 hours
-You can create your own guilds that can be levelled up with daily quests and achievements and will gain you additional perks


Cons
-The game tends to use quests like pick up _ of this and kill _ of a little to often that but aside from that quests are amazing
-Music is not exactly memorable but that doesn't really matter
-You can't change your race


This game is definitely worth picking up and playing and the best part is it's free I definitely recommend it to all who enjoy MMORPG

reviewText: Aura Kingdom is beautiful, which is generally not a surprise for a game whose basic art inspiration is clearly anime.  The color palette and many of the visual choices strongly reminded me of playing fighting games in the arcade back when I was a kid, especially during combat sequences. The initial leveling experience is fairly swift, comparable to the current starter zones in games such as Lord of the Rings Online or World of Warcraft.As for the gameplay - it's a game that's easy to get into but also easy to set down and forget in favor of more engrossing games.Like in all other MMORPGs, grinding is the theme of Aura Kingdom and the storyline can, at most of the times, be neglected.Overall, Aura Kingdom represents a welcome turn from Aeria Games to making a decent and family friendly MMORPG which manages to be a fun, polished, and addictive experience.

reviewText:
After playing and wanting to like it, I really just can't. Before starting why i should say i've played till level 26

At first i saw the anime style and many classes. I liked the look of it. That really is the only reason I can think of to like this game.

What can I say? It just feels like its designed for someone who doesn't really want to play. qeusting is pretty much one click to the objective, doing/killing one thing, and delivering it. Because of the auto-travel the world is not interesting and bland. To elaborate, this small area has creature type one, and this type 2. you don't even need to look at your surounding.

When I went into the first real dungeon that required a team, it was only one room and had 3 enemies. They weren't that hard to beat. Compare it to other MMO's and it just feels really boring and uninspired. Outside of the dungeons there isn't any room for teamwork either.

You level very fast, which just add to the idea that the game is for the lazy. Not even something like a mount is worth anything. You get handed your first mount during the first 10 levels of play, this game does not feel like making the player do something, You just go through the motions.

I geuss you get what you pay for, which is in this case: Nothing!

reviewText:
I only have 25 hours for this game and am currently level 46 so I don't think I can give a complete opinion but I will give you my opinion of it so far. What caught my eye for this game was the art style. Its probly one of the most anime looking artsyle for any mmorpg I have played and that was a huge motivation for me to start playing. That was a huge pro for me that made this game win me over. I will now talk about other pros which is the gameplay itself and some cons.

Pros:
-Great storyline
-Fast pace combat system
-Interesting pet system.
-Quests are unique and fun. Especially daily quests you do.
-Boss fights are highly addictive and does not make you stand in one place. Theres red paths that indicate when a monster is about to use a skill and you'd have to dodge it. Bosses in higher level will make it harder to actually dodge and make it a challenging experience.
-Not a P2W game at all. Most things you can get from the ap store are things you can get in-game for gold.
-Dual class feature
-Great anime art style
-Large class variety

Cons:
-The only appearance you can have in the game are costumes. Equipments does not show up at all. Its only costumes.
-Limited Character Customization
-Not many areas to explore when compared to other mmorpgs.

Overall a very highly addictive game with an amazing anime art style.  I highly recommend this mmorpg to any anime lovers out here.

reviewText:
OVERVIEW

Aura Kingdom is an anime MMORPG adventure published by Aeria Games. They were known for publishing a lot of popular online games such as Grand Fantasia,Eden Eternal,Alliance Of Valliant Arms,Soldier Front 2 and etc. The question is...like all other point & click MMORPG,does this deliver anybody high expectation or it just another dissapointing mess ? In my opinion i always preferred fast paced action MMORPG such as Vindictus,C9 & TERA,mainly because they are much more fun to play than watching a bunch of animation play out. Let find out if this game is any good.

GAMEPLAY : 7/10

As you start off,you are given ten classess to choose from. Ranging from Guardian,Ravager,Duelist,Grenadier,Gunslinger,Wizard,Sorcerer,Bard,Brawler & Ranger. I personally find Bard to be my type of class mainly due to the massive amount of support skills. Once you choose your class,you are given to create your own character. Dissapointingly,all you do is just choose a bunch of presets and limited colour to pick from. Which mean you gonna see a lot of clone character just with different outfit. After you create your character,you are given to choose 1 out of 4 different eidolons.They are basically your guardian which aid you in the battle. You also can do like a tag team combo with your eidolons.

Some problem i had with this game is the tutorial. It is like is half-done. In the beginning it doesn't guide you so you have to figured out a lot of things on your own. In some certain situation when you enable a quest,then they started introduce you the tutorial. Why not teach all the basic things in the beginning of the game ???

I have to give them a credit though for putting a auto quest tracker. Basically it make your character to automatically move to the destination quest. However it is poorly done since you would stuck in certain terrain or just stop half way.

Another problem i don't like is why they locked out some features unless you reach the specific level it required. It like you need achieve to level 10 in order to join guild and unlock the mail system.

While you don't get your mounts & your eidolons in the beginning of the game,you get them quite early once you completed few quest.

As for skills progression,you unlock a specific skills once you reach that specific levels. Example would be you reach level 4 to unlock Ambient Drone skill. You obtain a skill points every 2 or 3 level if i am not mistaken. From there you can upgrade your skills. It not that complicated as well as it not linear.

During combat,you can move around while your character performing auto-attack. You can avoid danger easily since there is a danger sign telling you where the spell are gonna land. This game doesn't have any MP bar system so basically you can just spam any skills you want. Your health will regenerate too no matter what class you choose. Mainly this type of decision they make is to target player who are new to MMORPG or to provide a less frustration experience.

GRAPHICS : 7/10

This game has an interesting artstyle and design choice. While the character models seems a bit off and doesn't blend well with the background,the monster models is impressive.

Animations is well done for the most part and it doesn't felt stiff except when you jump.

The texture details and environment look great especially in MAX settings.

There are certain NPC that walk in town to make the world feel a bit lively though they don't interact much.

The interface in my opinion is a clutter mess. Good things you can edit and adjust some of the UI.

AUDIO : 5/10

While i think the soundtrack in this game is marvelous. Most of the sound assets is quite poor. There is barely any voice acting when you have conversation with a NPC and your character doesn't yell,scream or grunt when performing certain actions. It feel like the character is lifeless and it just a walking robot. There is not much ambience to be heard either.

LONG-LASTING APPEAL : 7.5/10

Since the world is massive,there is much to explore especially if you playing with a friends. There is titles & achievements you can unlock,hidden & sub quest you can do,PvP,able to glide if you sick of walking on the ground & massive amounts of events. If you able to join a guild it would add more enjoyment to it as you can fight difficult bosses that you can't handle alone. Not to mentioned you can go fishing and swimming too. There are daily login rewards to encourage players to keep playing this game.

FINAL VERDICT : 6.6/10

Despite it flaws,i had some fun with this game especially the inclusion of eidolons. I recommend to people to those who want a light hearted and an enjoyable MMORPG.

I still got some de ja vu though since this game is like an upgraded version of Fiesta Online. It like both of these games have some resemblence to it.

GRADE : D ( Not Bad )

reviewText:
Okay i've played this game for over 100 hours (In 3 weeks :O)  time for a simple review.

First of all, this game has really beautiful graphics i just love the anime style ♪
You can have a companion (in this game named eidolon) with you and fight alongside your companion!

In the beginning this game is verry easy especially with leveling.

But when you reach level 40 this game becomes more challanging, leveling will become harder and you have to choose a secondary class. If you are going PVP and you choose the wrong secondary class you're gonna have a baaaad time ;3

If you think: oh i am so weak... i think i located my stats in the wrong way... No worries! you can re-locate them for some in-game money (not money where you need to pay for, but money you earn with quests like gold and silver)

Futher! There are lots of dungeons with: solo mode, party mode (up to 5 players) and hell mode.
For most dungeons, can you only enter a few times each day.

Doing quests is pretty boring (but in what MMO are they actually not)
There is a bulletin board where you can accept up to 5 quests each day, it are quests with dungeons! -yaaaaay o(＾∇＾)o -

And then there is a Sky tower :O It's a big dungeon with lots of floors (for lvl 60 players) on each floor you'll find lots of monsters and bosses and the best of all: gold gear,costumes, hats and other awesome stuff :3

And there is a Arena where you can do quizzes or fight to the death! You can check what time which gamemode will start.

It's totally not a pay to win game all of the stuff where you need to pay real money for, are sold by other players for gold, it are almost always costumes, mounts and stuff like that + there are plenty of outfits that you can get without some payment. AND you can earn loyality points and get the costumes & mounts and stuff like that for free :3 you don't even need to pay to get them. paying with real money in this game will only speed things up.

Everything in a nutshell (and some other things): It's not p2w, nothing is ugly everything is shaped gorgeous, Leveling is quite easy but overpowering someone is a challenge, the music on the background sounds great (in my opinion), fighting is pretty awesome there are lots of effects, you have a companion to take care of and get new ones on your journey
, eidolons spawn random on the world as a boss and you'll need LOTS of ppl to beat it, there are lots of dungeons and hanging around with other ppl is quite fun!

I just say try this game and see for yourself, the beginning can be boring but keep playing and you'll see all the great things (and less great things) for yourself! I hope you have a great time playing this game! (✿◠‿◠)

reviewText: It looks like a childish, easy, stupid, simple mmorpg at first glance, but you get into and you notice how complex it is. there are more classes than almost any game of its kind, each with totally different play styles. the eidolons, pets that help you fight, seem pointless at first but can be used very strategically. overall, it is a very addictive mmorpg, with very good class balancing and diversity.\n\n8.5/10 (10/10 when the few, minor bugs are fixed)

reviewText:
Okay i've played this game for over 100 hours (In 3 weeks :O)  time for a simple review.

First of all, this game has really beautiful graphics i just love the anime style ♪
You can have a companion (in this game named eidolon) with you and fight alongside your companion!

In the beginning this game is verry easy especially with leveling.

But when you reach level 40 this game becomes more challanging, leveling will become harder and you have to choose a secondary class. If you are going PVP and you choose the wrong secondary class you're gonna have a baaaad time ;3

If you think: oh i am so weak... i think i located my stats in the wrong way... No worries! you can re-locate them for some in-game money (not money where you need to pay for, but money you earn with quests like gold and silver)

Futher! There are lots of dungeons with: solo mode, party mode (up to 5 players) and hell mode.
For most dungeons, can you only enter a few times each day.

Doing quests is pretty boring (but in what MMO are they actually not)
There is a bulletin board where you can accept up to 5 quests each day, it are quests with dungeons! -yaaaaay o(＾∇＾)o -

And then there is a Sky tower :O It's a big dungeon with lots of floors (for lvl 60 players) on each floor you'll find lots of monsters and bosses and the best of all: gold gear,costumes, hats and other awesome stuff :3

And there is a Arena where you can do quizzes or fight to the death! You can check what time which gamemode will start.

It's totally not a pay to win game all of the stuff where you need to pay real money for, are sold by other players for gold, it are almost always costumes, mounts and stuff like that + there are plenty of outfits that you can get without some payment. AND you can earn loyality points and get the costumes & mounts and stuff like that for free :3 you don't even need to pay to get them. paying with real money in this game will only speed things up.

Everything in a nutshell (and some other things): It's not p2w, nothing is ugly everything is shaped gorgeous, Leveling is quite easy but overpowering someone is a challenge, the music on the background sounds great (in my opinion), fighting is pretty awesome there are lots of effects, you have a companion to take care of and get new ones on your journey
, eidolons spawn random on the world as a boss and you'll need LOTS of ppl to beat it, there are lots of dungeons and hanging around with other ppl is quite fun!

I just say try this game and see for yourself, the beginning can be boring but keep playing and you'll see all the great things (and less great things) for yourself! I hope you have a great time playing this game! (✿◠‿◠)
