reviewText:
I remember playing this game long ago, at the time like all MMO's Aura was something fresh for me to jump into and offered a different experience other mmorpgs couldn't give off. Aura Kingdom is a game that's simple to learn and grasp, I was able to get into it and learn a lot of things in a manner of minutes! The variety of classes allows a unique gameplay style for everyone, and the secondary weapon you can get later on just makes things even more challenging and fun.
The biggest pros in my opinion are:
-Variety of classes (more to come!)
-Eidolon systems, you don't need to be a summoner class to get an epic companion to fight with you!
-Awesome flashy skills
-Epic dungeons to explore with friends and intense, challenging fights
-Unique story and background, everything has a story
-How well the game pulls you in, once you start, you really can't stop playing

In contrast however, the cons in my choice are:
-You'll find yourself repeating fetch and kill quests, the occasional special quest with something else to it
-Unable to skip boring cutscenes that last awhile
-How unfair dueling systems can get, a level 70 can challenge a level 30 to a fight, seriously?
-Servers can be unstable time to time
-Leveling, becomes ridiculous in higher levels, quests only bump you up like 2%

The thing fantastic about Aura, there's always something to do, regardless if gameplay becomes reptative. How you play Aura is up to you, but the biggest things you need to remember:
-This is an MMO, if you understand the basics, you'll know long hours and patience go a long way and are needed to enjoy this game
-People have the grinding style of leveling, but in Aura that method won't really work, espicially later on, just do your quests, it wont kill you

I personally enjoy Aura, if you love MMORPG's and want to find one to kill time, have an awesome adventure with friends, or just flat out looking for something new, this is the game for you. I promise its worth every minute of gameplay.

reviewText:
This is a typical MMORPG game, nothing special, but I have taken a liking to it! I've played MMORPG games like Dragon Nest, Maplestory, Vindictus, and a few others. The pros and the cons may alter from person to person depending on their preferences. By the way, people who like anime artwork will definitely like this game! I'm going to point out some pretty specific stuff in this game instead of just going broad or a general view of the game.

The Pros:
-Very Easy and Casual Gameplay
-Cash currency is earnable in game
-Progessing in the game is quick
-Equipment is easily accessible
-Not pay to be the best
-Subclass system is great
-Friendly society
-Great artwork
-Skill animations are fancy
-A good amount of classes to select from

The Cons:
-Typical MMORPG
-Slow paced battle system

The cons are definitely something that would change someone's mind about playing this game, but if you ignore those two concepts of the game, you'll get to experience what Aura Kingdom truly has to offer.

reviewText:
Product received for free

Aura Kingdom review:
PLATFORM

Windows

DEVELOPER

X-Legend Entertainment

SYNOPSIS

Aura Kingdom is a new MMORPG that features detailed anime art style graphics to depict a sprawling fantasy world for players to journey through. In the game players are going to be accompanied by faithful interactive companions able to evolve and give support in battle.

In Aura Kingdom players can choose between eight classes, fight with a dynamic action combat system, and customize their their haracters with elaborate skill trees.

MAIN FEATURES


Detailed and Rich fantasy world

Stunning anime styled graphics

Huge selection of interactive companions

Unprecedented mobility

Dynamic and fast-paced action combat

Lots of customisation options regarding abilities and weapons

Completely free-to-play


A VIBRANT WORLD

Aura Kingdom features a vast and vibrant fantasy world illustrated in highly detailed anime styled graphics. Players will trek across beautiful landscapes and charming towns, meeting its inhabitants while exploring mysterious dungeons and climbing massive towers.

CLASSES & WEAPONS

The game presents rather than a usual class system, a system based on the weapon players may use, resulting in eight classes to choose from, but along the way they are able to select a secondary weapon normally wielded by one of the remaining classes. Each weapon provides unique skills that are unlocked automatically step by step upon reaching higher levels. With every new level, players are also able to put points into a passive skill tree that differs between classes.

Currently available are the following weapons: axe, dual daggers, sword & shield, staff, harp, grimoire, dual pistols and cannon.

COMPANIONS

In Aura Kingdom players are accompanied by companions which are far more than simple pets and an integral part of the game experience. These companions grow more formidable over the course of the game and gain powerful combat abilities-including joining with the player to initiate spectacular combo attacks.In addition these companions will remember your actions ingame, frequently conversing with the player about their past exploits and battles.

COMBAT & MOBILITY

In the game players are going to have unprecedented mobility both in combat and out, offering unique movement techniques to traverse the terrain. Players may utilise double-jumps to scale heights and glide forward through the air at high speed to cover ground faster than they ever thought possible. Even for low level players, it’s already possible to climb on the back of an extensive array of mounts.

This mobility allows for fast-paced and fluid battles. Position and quick thinking will enable them to dodge enemy attacks and stay on their feet. They can call in their companion to join them, granting access to powerful new abilities and spectacular combo attacks.

CUSTOMISATION

In Aura Kingdom the customisation is not limited to hair styles, costumes and accessories, but also allows adapting characters regarding their abilities and weapons. Players can choose which of their many abilities to power up to suit their play style, and change them around quickly and freely. They are encouraged to experiment with different setups often, as the right approach can mean the difference between victory and defeat.

Aura Kingdom does not present the common stats, but attack and defence points instead. Attacks points can be used to improve the character’s attack to inflict a larger amount of damage, the chance to land a critical hit, and the attack speed. Defence points can be employed to increase health, health regeneration and the chance to avoid an attack, as well as to reduce the amount of damage received.

reviewText:
This is my first time playing the game even though i heard about it before but I am glad it's on steam! If you are an Anime Freak like me, this game is absolutely for you! I just downloaded it and played 9 straight hours ! that's how addicting the game is! I got my character up 37 in one day so the leveling is really fast (of course if you keep doing the main quests). Aura Kingdom gives the atmosphere that you are inside the world. So first up you have the basic class choosing, customization, and tutorial. I am here to convince few people by telling my pros and cons i had so far from the game! HERE IT GOES!
Pros:
run smoothly even if you have a low graphics card (depends on your internet connection)
lowest setting still looks great
many classes to choose from and later in the game you can choose another class (lvl 40)
it's not really p2w or pvp MMO
The Music is soothing
All classes are balanced
You get your own partner that will help you throughout the game that you can talk to! ( Like Digimon some sort of)
Crowded Servers
Very exciting Dungeons
Not really a toxic player game
Story is pretty good for a MMO
Costumes are free by doing the main quests ( You get many costumes)
Sharing monster kills for quests ( normally you have to kill your own target but not in this MMO)
Automatic Healing potions usage at % health (you can turn it on or off and set it up at what % health you want to use it, IT'S VERY UNIQUE imo)
IT'S TOTALLY F2P !!!! Unless you like to support the developers by buying at their Shop Mall

Neg:
The same quests as go talk to him than him or kill this, pick up this etc ...
Pvp is restricted until later the game ( I Think)
Crowded server might crash your game ( Not for mine)
low internet connection is not recommended ( 25 mbps is recommended by me)
Social or chat is mehh, couldn't figure out how to make a new tab to make like a guild chat only, party chat only etc ... ( I couldn't find how)
Females are mostly males ( i have nothing wrong with it, but in an Anime MMORPG is creepy)
everyone can have the same helpers (it bothers me, they at least could put some customization to our helper)
Limited Bag Space that becomes annoying to clean up


Overall i would give it 8/10! Since the neg are mostly on the small issues than the gameplay. THIS IS MY ANALYSIS! I play Age of Wushu(Only PVP)  therefore it makes Aura KIngdom so unique for me. Play with your friends or cooperate with a stranger rather killing him in public. It's more of the Piece full games!
Sorry for the grammar but i wanted to help people by deciding to start or not! And give them general idea of the game!
Well i hope my review helped some of you out there!

reviewText:
I played this game in Open Beta.
Steam account connected very easily to Aeria account. No issues at all.

To my surprise when the game is loaded i see my old server and my previously used char.
It was all there. Awesome... No need to make all the questing from the beginning. :D

Don't see many differences from Open Beta. Even the good old bugs are there.
Hooo... good times.

>>> Now lets talk for real.

This game is not for the hardcore players like i used to be in WoW times.
This is a very easy and very casual game. If you want more than the casual questing, casual dungeon and casual PvP then go look somewhere else. This is not for you.

If you are looking for a polished anime style gameplay. This is the game.
The anime style graphics are very well done, the skills are gorgeous and you even have a pet/companion to help you.

Do not compare this game to Dragon Nest. Totally different graphics styles and gameplay. Never compared an Action MMORPG to a regular MMORPG.

If you like both games, install both and play both. They are both F2P.

Yes, the game have bugs but they are minor and the big ones don't even interfere with the gameplay.

PROS:
- Free to Play.
- Anime style
- Customizable UI
- Very easy gameplay
- Polished gameplay
- Beautifull graphics and animations

NEUTRAL:
- Nothing new. Thats normal, anything really new in MMORPG's since WoW or Everquest.
- Casual game, for casual players. The game was made like that. Don't like it, play something else.
- Music. I don't really pay attention to Music and if i use TeamSpeak I even turn it off.
- SoundFX. Polished sound effects.

CONS:
- No Mana, only cooldown system
- Some bugs
- Repetitive quests and dungeons

Overall, I like the game and will keep installed for when i want to play a easy, relaxing gorgeous anime style game.

>>> Currently installed games for casual playing:

- Team Fortress 2
- Aura Kingdom

reviewText: Now i know alot of games in the past have said they were based on an anime type theme, but this one actually holds true. so if your a fan of rpg's and anime id highly suggest trying it out, a long story quest and multiple dungeon/side quest areas you spend plenty of hours exploring. when it comes down to the elements of an rpg aura kingdom has a widely diversified feel so if you like 3rd person or 1st person views you can choose, theres alot of grinding of course and the quests feel repeated at first but after level 60 it takes off and theres plenty of party stuff to do although the party gathering system is a little rough. the graphics has a decent selection of options so even if your running a laptop or just an old pc that doesnt run MMO's very good you should be alright. When the graphics are turned all the way up it has quite the detailed environment, even tho it has a kind of animated feel which is just the style of game. all and all whether your an anime fan or just a fan or rpg's id highly suggest trying out aura kingdom, its definitely worth a few dozen hours of gameplay and even if your pc is crappy like mine lol, im sure you could figure a way to get it running, atleast i did. of coarse theres the little things that are always wrong with free to play rpg's, like they use the same monsters in different levels by just rendering them different colors and sometimes the graphic glitchs when jumping and casting skills but other than the usual little stuff but its definitely no pay 2 win, most of the item mall stuff is cosmetic and it can still be obtained by playing to complete quests and getting loyalty points which works like the AP which is aura point you pay for.

reviewText:
Great game that is for sure anyways I guess I'm gonna make a list, mane.

--PROS--
▲Great Visuals
▲Great controls
▲Great Cooldown, which allows for great PvE battle
▲Plenty of quests to keep you occupied
▲Great for anyone that likes anime or RPG. This game is kind of like GW.
▲Good storyline (In my opinion)
▲Balanced levelling syustem, which does not require much grinding if you do the right quests at the right times
▲Guilds n' stuffs
▲Can't really get too OP at start of game, which makes it fun.
▲Awesome Cutscenes (very few so allows for more gameplay)

--CONS--
▲Controls can get glitchy if ypou do multiple things at once, such as going into chat and moving at the same time
▲Lots of quests are go fetch! But still there are plenty worthy adventure quests to do that
▲Takes SO MUCH TIME on FIRST LOAD, other than that it's fine.
▲Never press the full scan button.
▲Going on a different server can cause your character to not be on that server. Play on the server that you created your character on (if you made it on hydra, play on hydra)
▲Alot of trade spammers. I would recommend turning trade off in general. Keep trade channel for trade only.

I guess that's my review of this great game. If the developers read this, good job guys! I recommend this game for anyone who likes RPG and anime pretty much.

reviewText:
As an Anime fan, but not a big MMO fan, i was in search of japanese created games and i stumbled upon this.
I can't say much about this game yet becouse i am writing this review after 6 hours of gameplay.

Well, first things first. This game is trully an Anime like game. This is the biggest plus in this game so far. NPCs are quite unique, though i sometimes feel a repetitive scene when fighting some mobs (especially humans, like pirates), but still creature mobs are so unique and interesting that i feel a pleasure just roaming and watching them pass me by.

Bad thing is that quests are dull. Like, take that, bring that, kill that, collect that. It's pretty much repetitive. But its not a problem for a free game (most of the rpgs have same kind of quests anyway). There are many hidden quests, that start with the player checking some container or an item. And there are alot of bounties, side quests and stuff like that. It's all about numbers, not quality.

There are 9 classes to choose from. The character creation is so loyal to anime/manga fans that most probably most of you will enjoy. There are some elements that are quite new to me (becouse i dont play MMO often). Like, none of the skills have mana requirements, only cooldowns. And there is no typical Strenght, Endurance, Energy leveling. You get ATK Points and DEF points. In ATK section you level damage, critical hit chance or attack speed, and in DEF section you level armor rating or evasion.

You can have a pet here. Ranging from faries to ponies (Yes, MLP fans, this game is for you too!) That pet levels with you and it can get you presents every 10 minutes for some kind of energy points. To restore points, you need to talk with your pet. The dialogue is pretty solid, sometimes fun. So you need to take care not only about your character, but about your pet as well.

Overall, this game is still in open beta stage. There are some bugs, sometimes server lags and that kind of stuff. This game isn't the perfect game ever, some things really bug me (like, why doesnt character look depend on a costume but not the armor?). But still, i had a pleasure playing it. So check that out, for a free game and for a beta stage, it's awesome.

Pros:
+ Loyal to anime fans (even MLP?)
+ Beautiful world
+ Pretty much original
+ Nice soundtrack
+ Awesome Eidolon (Pet) system.

Cons:
- Bugs and freezes
- Missing sounds for enemy mobs or ambience.
- Only 10 hairstyles :(
- This game begs you to find friends, becouse some quests can't be passed without a party.
- Mini-games with you controling other NPCs feel unfinished and lousy.
- Disguises just give you a model to wear, not a costume itself.

Final Verdict:
7 hairstyles out of 10

reviewText:
Didn't know this was on steam but gonna review as an Aeriagames player anyway.
Simple Summary:
+Everyone have a partner: Eidolon, that assist in combat and give you diverse option of choose that small percentage of shared stats.
-some can be accessed through immense effort while most latest can be easily obtained by pay2win, thats normal in a free MMO
+every part of the world have the usual level range and quests, you can venture freely doing many immersive side quest
-most character's combat are based on stomping keys
+the skill tree and path for stats are diverse, a player can have 2 class specialization with more skills.
-From the above 2 points, this contrast may fall on an ironic side for certain players
+you can glide while travelling around the [field]world freely, or with a mount
-It gets grindy like any other casual MMO
+Efforts are tolerable in gear and level (thanks to being able to fly)
-proffesions effort are intolerable if included in your journey (they're still rarely considered for most players to utilise)
+gr8 music, tho short
-endgame contents are short (as at 2014), which is probably why reaching max level from a few levels away is intensely hard.
-changing instances is a 'skill' LEL
-hardly noticeable craftings
-Bots.... a shietload .__.

Conclusion: 7.5/10 for those that likes free MMO, 4.5/10 for the others. #nohashtag

reviewText:
The game is very simple. Even the hidden quests have markers on the minimap with clues on the items you recieve. The only hidden thing is the conversations you can overhear, getting all of them in an area grants a bonus.

I played 10 hours before I got stuck on a bug. I assume a relog would fix it but I quit the game instead at level 28. The game is simply too easy. I once dropped below 30 % in 10 hours. I used a total of 2 health potions.

There was one forced group battle at level 20, nobody in our group dropped below 70% hp.

Besides that it is a fun game with gliding fast over the terrain between quest and monster. Often able to glide up a cliff to report a quest within 20 s of it being done. It progresses fast and teaches you mechanics and systems as you go along if you do all the quests in the area. The equipment gets upgraded as well, with some sets needing to defeat instances multiple times for drops (longest time to complete one was 2 min for me).

The biggest upside in the controls for this game is that you can click on the minimap and the character will go there. You can even click on characters to go up to them or enemies. Playing SW mmo you realise quickly how big this improvement is.

reviewText:
'Aura Kingdom' is one of the anime-style rpg games.

About graphics in this game, Of course, it may not be great when compared with other games.
Actually, I don't like role playing games with anime style, like this game, 'Aura Kingdom'.
but I think the graphics of 'Aura Kingdom' is enough to express its anime style.

About the system, The system in 'Aura Kingdom' looks good. You can make friends, parties, or guilds freely. Furthermore, you can fight against enemies with your pets. Classes are various, you can choose one of these classes freely. you can select a second class when your level is at least 40. Also, you can fish and make a couple with a friend. It's possible to do many kinds of things. These things make your game style various. these are good points about 'Aura Kingdom'.

But there are some bad points in 'Aura Kingdom'.

First, Pay-to-win. Of course, 'Aura Kingdom' is a Free-to-play game, and other online and free-to-play rpg games have this pay-to-win system. But when your level is at least 55-60, The difference between 'paying' and 'not paying' may be bigger than you expect.

Second, You'll download the client which size is 4.3GB through Steam. However, After you finish to install that, and when you start this client at the first time, You'll download additional files, The size of these files is about 1.5GB. I have no idea why they didn't update game files in Steam. I think Downloading through Steam is faster than downloading through their servers, in some countries. Also this can lessen their servers burdens.

Finally, About servers. Sometimes, their servers are insecure. For example, One day, Users couldn't login to this game for few hours because Aeria servers were down. I know they do the maintenance work in servers, but they are still insecure.

In short, 'Aura Kingdom' is a well-made and good game even though there are some bad points.
If you have enough time to play this and want to try this game, try this, It may not be bad, because this game is a free-to-play game.

reviewText: I still don't understand why some guys gave some bad review for this game. This is the first time I really enjoy a MMORPG that I level up to 50 in 45+ hours of gameplay. For example, you could miss a shot if the monsters move away or stand too far.\n\nI'll give it 8.5 out of 10. Not perfect/original, but it was worth playing.

reviewText: This game is one of my favorites. reviewText:
Honestly, this is one of the few Anime RPGs that is actually good that doesn't make you pay a cent.
Pros :
-Addictive gameplay
-Beautiful and colourful world
-Some awesome fighting animations
-Lovely music
-It's 100% free.

Neutrals :
-It's quite easy to level up.

Cons : (THESE DO NOT MAKE IT A BAD GAME, I STILL LOVE IT)
-Physics are very strange, as in invisible barriers sometimes, glitchy stair-walking, and some other things like phasing through rocks/tree trunks.
-Players in the chat rarely try to roleplay (at least in my servers...), and usually just spam it with trade things.
-You can't transfer a player to another server, but it's easy to level up so whatever.

Overall, I found this game amazing. If you enjoy Anime and MMO RPGs, then you'll love this.
9.6/10

reviewText:
This game is beautiful, it's got great anime style graphics and an amazing set of armour and clothing choices.

10/10 for graphics.
8/10 for game optimization
5/10 for difficulty
and 10/10 for gameplay.

This game in a whole is worth playing, it's fun in short. It's a /Extremely/ easy game for all to play. I played it for 11 hours and got from level 1 - level 42, I had a create time conversing with the commuinity of the game and fighting my way through the typical sort of mmo questing sysetem. The dungeons are probably the best bit of this game, especially the bits of seen for hell-mode. The dungeons are insane, so much colours and things going on at once you really feel like you're controlling some sort of really OP anime character.

Pro's-

-F2P and a very good F2P model at that.
-Beautiful world to explore.
-A great anime style; probably the best yet.
-Fun gameplay.
-A lot of the quests are completely opptional it won't /make/ you pay for anything to get along in the game.
-Easy, this could be good or bad depending on your opinion.

Con's-

This is going to be the biggest thing I'm going to raise, because it's what made me stop playing.
-The AP store, the place where you use real money to buy in game things, not important things that give you an advantage over anyone else, just mounts, costumes, random things...AND THE F**KING SUBCLASS CHANGE. That's right, being a Noob" to this game I had know idea that you're supposed to take a certain subclass taht went well with the first class you had
date: it would be fine if this change costed in game currency or a small amount of loyalty points. BUT NO. it costs\n!!!£20!!!\nFor something that small but still something so drastic and needed for the gameplay
recommended:
for this single thing the developers get!

0/10! EA STATUS.

-The game is your typical mmo. Kill 9 of these
hoursPlayed: then hand in the quest. It's normally okay though since it's masked by the beautiful gameplay.\n-The music was ♥♥♥♥

Gunslingers rule the battlefield.

In short

reviewText: This game really impressed me, out of all the free to play mmorpg's on Steam, this one I recommend over all others. This game has a multitude of good aspects, for instance the classes. This game has a large amount of classes available immediately, and in addition at level 40 you can choose a second class. The game has absolutely no need to spend real money in, leveling is fairly well paced throughout the game (I've only had to grind for a level twice) and all items you can spend money on are either customisation, mounts (you get one for free before you even reach level 10), or items you can get by playing the game. The game also has a great guild system, which encourages members to aid their guild so it can level up to provide bonuses to all members of the guild. Graphically the game actually looks pretty good, with an anime inspired art design and some decently creative orginal monster designs. Gameplay is your standard hotkey system mmorpg style, while I have railed on this system multiple times in the past, this game did it well in my opinion. Unlike other games using the hotkey system, Aura Kingdom made it enjoyable by 1. Not requiring me to mash a button for my standard attack (I'm looking at you Star Wars the Old Republic) 2. Having enjoyably flashy ability animations and 3. providing a cool combo system with the second class (which with the correct combinations of weapons can lead to powerful special abilities). The only complaint I have with this game is the story, it's not bad and it's not the game's fault that I don't enjoy it. Due to the previously mentioned Star Wars the Old Republic I have a hard time enjoying mmorpg's that don't at least have voice acting, though as said it's my fault. If you enjoy games with an anime art style, mmorpg's, or mmo's in general, you will love this game and I can't recommend it enough. Other wise definitely give it a shot. Finally though, if you aren't a fan of any of the previously mentioned then admittedly this game won't change your mind on the genre.

reviewText:
As an avid player of MMORPGs, this caught my eye immediately (especially when it came to Steam and I didn't have to use the Aeria Games launcher, kekeke) when I saw it.

You play as an Envoy of Gaia, and because of this you can summon creatures known as Eidolons to fight alongside you. Dragons, maidens, fairies, unicorns, golems, all sorts. To start with, I picked Grimm, and have recently unlocked Sigrun and Gigas. You can name these anything you want, so the names don't particularly matter. There are plenty of different classes to fit your playing style. I, personally, have used a Bard - a healing class - all the way to level 43 as of writing this. I chose Sorcerer as my secondary class at level 40. The stats system is a little unbalanced and there are glitches here and there, but the game as a whole completely overpowers these with its good graphics and intuitive game mechanics

The game itself is gripping and the mechanics are amazing. It's clean, tells you everything you need to know and has a deep, fleshed out story and world. The art style is also adorable, so if anime-style games are your thing, AK is for you. What I love most is the questing mechanics. Any item you need to use or make is shown in the quest tracker, and all you have to do is double click the objective and you automatically travel there on an adorable ostrich by the name of Beebis. What I love is that killstealing does not exist. So long as you contribute to the killing of an enemy, everyone gets the same amount of XP, the kill registers and everyone gets their own drops, so no need to worry about someone else stealing your kill for a quest.

It looks a little inaccessible once you see all of the different things you can do, such as fortification, equipment salvaging and feeding your Eidolons with experience crystals. However these are introduced in interactive quests, and are presented very well.

My one complaint is the abundance of jiggle physics in the female characters... but hey, it's an anime game, and it's rather unnoticeable except for the female Eidolons. If anything, it's hilarious to watch!

I would highly recommend to any fantasy RPG lover.

reviewText: I've been playing this game since the closed beta. When the game finally launched I've been playing this for a few months. Now I'm back I don't really see significant changes, but when I played the game I did really enjoy it. Before this game was even launched I was really attracted to the way Aura Kingdom looked. The looks of it were quite promising. Always when I play a MMO I would play it for a few months but then I would take a break. After stopped playing this I haven't found any good MMO's.\n\nThis game is quite easy in the beginning. You're able to grind really easy but near level 40 it gets a lot harder and it takes mor time to level up. It's fantastic that you're able to use 2 classes on one character. When you've come that far you can use the skills of your second class together with the primary class that you have. Furtherhand I would like to say that this game is a really good starter for people who haven't been playing MMO's. Since the tutorial is very clear it's easy to understand how everything works.

reviewText:
Honestly, this is one of the few Anime RPGs that is actually good that doesn't make you pay a cent.
Pros :
-Addictive gameplay
-Beautiful and colourful world
-Some awesome fighting animations
-Lovely music
-It's 100% free.

Neutrals :
-It's quite easy to level up.

Cons : (THESE DO NOT MAKE IT A BAD GAME, I STILL LOVE IT)
-Physics are very strange, as in invisible barriers sometimes, glitchy stair-walking, and some other things like phasing through rocks/tree trunks.
-Players in the chat rarely try to roleplay (at least in my servers...), and usually just spam it with trade things.
-You can't transfer a player to another server, but it's easy to level up so whatever.

Overall, I found this game amazing. If you enjoy Anime and MMO RPGs, then you'll love this.
9.6/10

reviewText: Playing a small amount of this game, I quite like it. Gameplay and combat is good and the game is well polished although there are a few major problems. The game auto sets resolution on first open to 800x600, there is too much hud and makes the game a little harder to concentrate and play on with hud crowding every edge of your screen completely, this hud needs to be simplified. Lastly the combat although good and interesting, it needs a tweak so you can lock onto targets if you wish and some other fixes. All in all though, its a good game. 7/10

reviewText: I've started the game a few days before it was released on Steam. For any anime mmorpg fans that are looking for a good casual game to play, this would be it! The quest system in this game is farily easy since it has a tracking system as well whether you need trouble or just lazy to go to the area. reviewText:
Ok, so after weeks of addiction, its about time I posted my thoughts on Aura Kingdom! :D

The Game
Ok so Aura Kingdom is an awesome Free 2 Play Fantasy/Anime MMO. Set in the semi-linear world of Azuria, you are an Envoy of Gaia, a human with special abilities and the power to summon powerful & mysterious partners called Eidolons to your aid, as you travel the world, defeating monsters, helping the towns, and defending against the ShadowKnights, a strange and powerful foe!

Discover your Eidolons true potential by fighting alongside with them and leveling them up, into more powerful forms (somewhat like Pokemon :P ) and use their skills to aid you in battle with the upper-hand!

12 awesome classes to choose from, including Ravager (High DMG), Scythe (Necromancer) & Grenadier (2-Handed Cannon Wielder), and blast, slice & shoot through the games many challenging dungeons and Main Quest line. Become a dual-class at Lvl40 with the ability to adopt a 2nd classes skills (for example a Tachi + Katar), and gain many more kickass skills and abilities!

Pro's
- Very balanced classes (PvP can be won by any mix-up of classes)
- Amazing soundtrack (very fitting for areas, a little repetitive, but fitting)
- Great Group Events (including Battlefields, enhanced Dungeons, and special Party Quests)
- Smooth Graphics (easy on the eyes, simple, but aestheticly pleasing)
- Lots of backstory / lore (Simply read what people have to say, it will make sense)
- Not Pay2Win (Can easily get to Max Lvl with High Quality gear, without spending a cent! (although you can get some cool looking apparel and mounts, etc for some cash if you wanna spend)

Con's
- Main Quests can be pretty repetitive (lots of Fetch Quests, Kill X Amount of Monsters, etc)
- Hit Boxes is slightly Buggy (sometimes cannot target opponent until they hurt you first)
- Sudden jump in EXP needed to Lvl after 45 (1-45 quick leveling, 45+ is grindy)

OVERALL
Overall, I love Aura Kingdom, its an amazing MMO that I would highly recommend trying, especially with friends (plus Bonus EXP in parties so Win-Win! XD)

Give it a go, and if you don't enjoy it, no money was lost since F2P! :D

Overall Score - 8.5/10

reviewText:
I thought I'd put in my imput on this game. First off, when looking for an MMO with Anime Graphics and free-roam style... this is so far the only game that has hit the spot. I fell in love and I now have been playing it non-stop for three days, just short of 40 hours now.

TRUE - Players are not overly friendly and do not go out of their way to say Hello or RolePlay (I come from World of Warcraft) so players NOT roleplaying was a little different.
FALSE - Players only seek to use you. I've met some very nice people and have joined a guild that is actually reasonably social. Good players are out there, they are just hidden. Hah.
TRUE - The Quests are mostly gathering and killing - basic MMO stuff. Still, I love them because if you listen to the story behind them, they actually make sense. In WoW - they say go get some candles. No explanation for why... just go get me some freaking candles. So you do. In this game, your goal is clear and everyone's quests are to help them help you. It makes sense why you go gather mushrooms or kill beetles.
TRUE - The AI and BOT models are VERRRRRY overused, but I don't mind it much. As for player models, I haven't seen any close look-alikes and the character creation gives just enough imput.

Other Things I Love?
I love classifying in two specializations. So i can use guns and swords, etc. It's very cool and something I was sad they started taking away from World of Warcraft (its basically nonexistant).
I love the dungeon system. Dungeons are completely solo-able or you can join up and do a party-version. This makes it easy for SOLO players (like myself) to get everything in the game accomplished without searching for people I don't even want to talk too.
The game is easy. Not in the sense that it offers no thrill or excitement, but its not overly complicated. Everything is explained in words first and then (for visual people like myself), most everything has a little video to also explain how each element works. Using Gems is explained, creating armor and gear, and even fishing.
Fishing is FUN. Its also one of the easiest places to get Gold (WInk WINk).
I Love the Companions - they are fun and sooo helpful. I especially Love Merilee!!
Costumes are great - no mismatched ugly gear while you're leveling. The best ones must be bought however (SIGH)

What I Don't Like?
No open world RolePlay - but thats ok. Hey, if you want to Look Me Up. I love Roleplay
Not a whole lot of servers.
Can only create 9 characters, but there are 12 classes [This isn't overly important since they have duel-classification at level 40, so you can make up for lost classes then.]
Gold Farming is Slow. And I do mean SLOOOW. I've farmed gold for weeks in several games but I've never had so much difficulty as in this one.
In-Game Real Money:: I've always had a problem with this in games. It bothers me that I can't buy nice things with Gold. They have implemented another Currency to get most of these Real Money items, but its a lot of work (almost too much). Still - despite adding this it is in no way PAY to WIN. You don't have to spend any money to be freaking amazing in this game.

I don't if my review helped. But these are some things that I looked at, disliked, loved, and enjoyed.

Overall. Get this Game. If you like RPGs with a GOOD Storyline (who doesnt?), Anime Graphics, and MMO, get this game. People say a lot of crap. But this game has been completely worth it for me. :)

reviewText:
I put about 100+ hours into this game before getting it on steam. I've been playing it for almost a year now and I honestly cannot think of a single bad thing to say about it.

The game itself is generally very easy. I love everything from the look of it, to the fighting, and the story line. Even after making multiple characters and doing the same quests over and over again I just can't seem to get bored of it. It does start to get a little slow around level 50-60 but that's basically every mmorpg game at a certain point. I also think it has the best community for a game that I've seen in my opinion. People are just extremely friendly and generous.

The only thing that frustrates me about it is trying to get enough gold to buy stuff at the auction house. The prices for some of the costumes and mounts tend to be a little ridiculous (if you want something that the game doesn't already give you or just isn't basic) and as someone who doesn't want to spend actual money on the game, it gets annoying having to wait so long to save up enough for something that probably won't be there in 24 hours or less when you finally have enough. Also the spam from bots trying to sell you gold is utterly annoying, I can't even tell you how many I've had to block.

Overall though I would 10/10 suggest this game if you're looking for something fun to play with fun people to play with.

reviewText:
Hey guys.

As most of you may know,
A lot of people have had problems making purchases in this game, and I happened to be one of those people.
When you make a purchase, it says in the terms of agreement that the transaction may take up to 24 hours.
MAKE SURE that you are registered to the website and you have confirmed your email before you make a purchase.
If you are having an Error next to your Aeria Points Icon on the website,
MAKE A TICKET!
But when you make a ticket, give them time to respond.
THE MORE YOU COMMENT ON A TICKET, THE LONGER IT WILL TAKE FOR THEM TO GET TO IT.
This is due to the fact that it resets the queue position every time you comment on your own ticket.

A Quick Note:
It states CLEARLY on their terms of agreement,
that they DO NOT give refunds, so with that said, tread carefully.

Here is the message I recieved from The Billing Department.

Dear SirMoustachio
date:
Thank you for contacting us.

After further investigation of the account
recommended: we have fixed the issue and you will now be able to access your account and the AP along with it to purchase items in game.\nWe apologize for any inconvenience that this might have caused you. Please log into your game to verify that you are able to play and use your AP. If you have any other problems
hoursPlayed: please contact us again.\n\nNote that everytime you answer your ticket before we do
voteText: it refreshes its queue order
helpfulPercent:
which doesn't help us giving you a quick answer.

Thank you for your understanding.

Regards

Your Team Aeria / Billing Department "

reviewText:
I personally enjoy Aura Kingdom because of th Log Horizon and SAO feel of the game. I love anime and I've been searching for a really well graphical anime mmo and thankfully I came across Aura Kingdom. I know some people who just find this game down right boring but if you grab even one person to join you in your adventure you will definitely have fun. My friend and I made new characters and everytime we learned a new skill we dueled one another, although I got obliterated by him it was still fun to get far into the game together. A lot of yelling and a lot of skipping quests that we regret skipping lol. If you wanna play a well designed anime mmo then Aura Kingdom is the one for you. I hope this helps and possibly convinces some of you.

Pros:

1. Dual class system at level 40.
2. Eidolon/Pet creativity
3. Amazing cutscenes that you wouldn't want to miss

Cons:

1. Although this may seem like a stupid con for some of you, leveling is to fast for my liking. In about one day my friend and I got to level 30 (no we didn't stay up the whole night). I like to take it decently slow and sometimes stop for amazing sights.

Overall: I think this game is great besides the leveling system and don't worry it's not really pay to play unless you just want a cool mount, I think the free mount that you recieve is cool enough. I mean come on, who doesn't wanna run around exploring on a FREAKING OSTRICH?!

Edit: I know I don't have many hours on this game but that is because I used to play it outside of steam and quit it since I got a bit seperated from the game and then when I saw it on steam it brought back good memories.

reviewText:
It's a fun MMORPG with very thick PvE gameplay. So, for reference if you had played another MMORPG, Aura Kingdom might be similar to Luna Online for monster, enemy, and environment. Perfect World for its Quest Based Leveling (yes dungeon & quest are your primary source for level, farming & killing mobs are not necessary).

But to top of it, Aura Kingdom compile the best part of MMORPG to date, not too keen for Pay To Win because most dependable item are available through ingame, and you may get items from item mall with Token (available to get) instead of Aeria Points.



But every review must have its con, so in my opinion, this game is lack of support from developer and game provider Aeria itself, lack of update, bug fixing, and so on.

TL;DR
If you're just a casual player that want some fun without any progressive playing and money-spending, this one suits you best. not necessary to P2W, decent gameplay with friends, and since it's PVE centered, no need of ++++weapon & armor that you should buy with money from other people or grinding too much.

reviewText:
I suppose writing a review for this game is in order.

*Ahem*

Aura Kingdom is a free to play (mmo) game licensed by Aeria Games. During my first week into the game, I was greeted with the traditional anime esc story about how you are the main character and the world revolves around you. Now this being an MMO I grew tired of reading through everyones dialouge and skipped most of the story until I found myself in Navea. Navea is the main hub for players to sell their items, fight players, window shop, etc. Having made my way to lvl 20 and viewing everyone elses cool costumes and items, I found myself looking through the Auction House. I will say this right now... DO NOT spend any money on this game. Every item can be obtained by completing quests or dungeon running, although it will take far longer your wallet will be thanking you in the end.

Now that the fancy costumes are out of the way, we can begin talking about the combat system. Combat in Aura Kingdom is very... spammy? Without knowing any better, you will soon be allocating all your combat points into speed which will reduce the cooldown on all of your abilities. Now with infinite ability spamming, the bosses in this game are a lot easier and reduce the amount of time you spend in dungeons. All in all, the combat system is nice but very broken with the cooldown on all of your abilities... especially the bard class.

Would I recommend the game? Yes. Aura Kingdom is a free to play game with a lot potential but is wasted on broken builds and abilities. However, the world is very fruity and with new patches being released every month or so it makes up for the mistakes that it clearly made.

reviewText:
I'm still not sure if I'd say YES or NO for this game and it makes me wish that there's a MAYBE option for the reviews...

Why I'd say YES is that the game nas a good story to it, nice mechanics and partly uses the old 'find the NPC you need' system. Sadly though, the story quests are fixed NPCs and you can walk there with auto-path (I even tried the game while knowing the feature is there).

I'd say NO because the animations are very clunky and the game lags like hell. Though lag might also be caused for the servers to be located on the US West-coast while I play from Europe, I would certainly play more if it wasn't such an issue.

Last but not least, the cash shop. I'm too low in the game to be able to judge Pay2Win or not, but it does look like it's Pay2Win. This while there's a lot of fluff cosmetic, mounts and eidalons (not sure how severe P2W those are) in it as well.

In general said YES because I think the game is fun to play...

As a fairly popular MMO that has recently been added to steam, it makes you wonder what the team behind Aura Kingdom is doing with their time and money. That being said, the game itself is nothing special. The tacky writing in the tuturial is enough to make any self respecting gamer cringe. Combat is mind numbingly easy and thoughtless, offering little in terms of interesting gameplay. Movement is awkward unless you enjoy point and click styles you would find in any RTS. You play this game for the dressup, and only that.

reviewText:
Aura Kingdom, The Sweet Kick A_s and Adorable MMORPG !
With over 200hr on playing is a bit late to write the review on thin game but still, I have something to say.

This game is really well done in many case. The Graphic is Good, better than many game out there. Design in Anime style is so advantage to attract many players. Music is Nice. Storyline is pretty interesting and Finally, Battle is Outstanding. From skill to skill, you can serve your enemy with the Cool-Connecting Combo up on your style. Stack up DPS or Screw the enemy with 1st and 2nd Combination Ultimate Skill.

Class Balance is Great. No MP or SP to worry because the cool down time is the only thing you must consider, to manage your fighting rhythm....The Best Combo System I ever play.

Choose the Player Class and build up your own character, gender and face and Side Kick Eidolon. and Play out the DEJAVU opening style mission, Pretty interesting opening intro stage. So you can try out many class in the very first stage and change it if you want to try other play style.
But if you climb up to Over 50Lv, things will go more harder in many way. That's mean if you put your effort fight all the way til Lv50, the real battle just begin from this place. (Some player quit, Some player continue)

One of The Best F2P. You can use (Real) money to buy stuff if you want but basically, you can get almost of them by your effort....kinda hard but still has a chance.
The Only annoying thing is BOT.....Just leave them alone or turn off the [other player invisible] button. (Or steal their kill count is the fast way to end the quest too)

One Best thing and the last is [PANTIEs] ! Many type of girl and many kind of Pantie they put on (YES, SO ANIME). Go Sneaking them is one of the Entertaining thing (No Joke)

reviewText:
I played this game a lot, for 3 days. i'm not sure if i'm going to keep playing.

If you've played WoW, you can tell this game took a lot of cues from there. In a few ways this game is actually better than WoW, however, the only reason you should play this over WoW is if you want to save money or just really want something Anime themed.

Leveling up starts out extremely fast and i like that. i wanted to get to the end game content fast. I wanted to reach level cap asap and start PvPing. As you quest, you learn new abilities at a good pace, you can easily auto-path from one place to another so it flows really well. quest path is linear so it's pretty much going along for a ride, slaying mobs and gathering items like nobody's business. there is a ton of dialog, i skipped as much as i could, seeing as it's not exactly a riveting story in my opinion.

The UI could stand a lot of improvement. it's somewhat customizable but not nearly as much as i'd like. The graphics are ok, the anti aliasing sucks and i can't configure it with the Nvidia control panel but i used sweetFX and it looks better. you can tell the game is optimized for japaneze localization as a lot of the english text is awkward, not fitting into its box, missing spaces, etc. it was translated pretty well but the ui is just not quite optimal for english it seems.

The class system is neat, you pick a main class and then when you hit level 40 you pick a secondary class and start learning those abilities. those abilities have longer cooldowns, however, and don't benefit from your masteries or talent specs.

Anyway, the reason i am losing interest is because as i hit level 60, the game became extremely grind-y. the pace of leveling drastically slows down, and until level 62 you're basically just doing dailies. your Eidolon, basically a combat pet that everyone has, doesn't level with you, you ahve to feed it XP crystals, and having fed one that was almost my same level since around 30, with every xp crystal i had got my hands on until then, it still fell behind. There are a lot of things you have to grind items for in this game, that's one of them. you can buy or farm for these XP crystals, secret stones
date:
scrolls and shards, crafting ingredients, etc... a lot like WoW, but it's just not clear at all on the best way to farm or grind for this stuff, and when you do figure it out it's disappointing how long it will take.

the game makes money with an in-game shop where you can pay real money to get stuff, not that it's p2w but you can save a lot of farming and grinding from there.

So at level 60 i decided to see if i could stop leveling and just start PvPing. then i discovered that pvp is split into only two tiers: 60 and below and above 60. and battlegrounds are scheduled, with 3-4 occurring per day. so to farm honor points for pvp gear you can't just queue into BGs over and over, you have to log in at the right time. and before you get this gear, you're going to get eaten alive in the arena events and such.

as PvP is my favorite thing to do in these games, i was really hoping to be able to jump in and get decent pvp gear before too long, but there's just not a good way to farm war coins" and "valor coins" at all
recommended: to get the gear. Not to mention the game's content is pretty much capped out at 60 even though the level cap is 80
hoursPlayed:
so i have no clue how people get to level 80 seeing as it's taking forever to get just 10% of the way to level 61.

the game went from super fast-paced and easy to ridiculously slow and confusing. and the pvp system sucks. so i think i'll just hop in once in a while to do daily quests and large battlegrounds when i can until i finally have decent pvp gear and can actually have some fun.

"
voteText: March 18, 2015

reviewText:
I've been playing a lot more than it says I have on Steam, but I recently downloaded it again from Steam because I'm weird like that and I like all my games to be in Steam if possible.
Anyways, this is a real gem in an ocean of crap F2P games.

Good:
--------------------------
Awesome story that makes sense and is easy to follow

Beautiful world, amazing attention to detail and a real joy to just look around

The things you can buy from the store can also be earned (usually in several different ways) from in-game things as well or you can easily and *safely* earn free Aeria Points by installing and playing apps on your phone or watching a minute long video.

Translation is spot on.  I haven't seen any issues and usually with games like this half the quest text makes 0 sense.

As you progress you have several ways of changing and making yourself better.  From talent trees to mastering skills to adding gems, enchants and fortifying armor and weapons.

Great sense of humor.

A lot of classes to choose from which are not sex locked.

Lots of different looks without even mentioning costumes and dyes and all of that, I'm just talking about character creation.

Every day you log back in you are greeted with a free present and your Eidolon as well.

Eidolons.  These are exceptionally well done battle pets" (bascially) with stories and personalities all of their own.  They don't just level
date: you help them to level and to better themselves as you progress as well.  Not only are there several to choose from or earn but they all have their own way of speaking
recommended: seeing the world and battling.  Some are healers
hoursPlayed: others plain warriors and so on.  They can be evolved at certain levels with the right items
voteText: given items to up their stats permanently
helpfulPercent: you have conversations with them on a regular basis and they give you great gifts which can help both of you a lot in the long run.  This is by far
votesHelpful: one of the most impressive battle pets systems I have ever seen in any game
votesTotal: and it's free to play!\n\nAuto-route.  I have no idea why
votesFunny: some people see this as a bad thing but I don't understand that at all.  You can open the map up
commentsCount: find a specific NPC and just run to them without having to worry.  I don't see a problem with this and with all of the other types of games I have played
column16: I just see it as it's own game mechanic.  You don't have an "auto kill everything" feature so it isn't game breaking in the least.  If you don't like it
column17: just don't use it.  I see this as only a plus and will not name this as a con for any reason.\n\nThe way they did quests is not only pretty clever
column18: it's also very fun.  When you approach an NPC and click on them to start a quest a small box will take over your screen.  You can then watch the interaction between your character and the NPC as they engage in quest conversation.  It's really cute
column19: allows you to cut off the rest of the MMO world for a moment to get into what you are doing and also lets you see the amount of emotions displayed in a really fun way.  I really like it.\n\nI've played four different classes
column20: all of which had spells and attacks that were very different from one another.  Battle Bow looks nothing like another class
column21: which some of these F2P MMOs do and it is very boring.  The attacks and spells in this game are vibrant
column23: fast-paced and well thought out.  You cannot just mash buttons either
column24: which I really appreciate.  You have a global cooldown on all abilities.  Speaking of abilities
column25: you can do a combo with your Eidolon.  It is unique to each one and does a ton of damage.  Even the healer types have one they can do with you.  Very fun
column26: awesome to watch.\n\nAuto-potions.  I love this feature as well and will not say this is a con either
column27: for any reason.  You don't like it don't use it.  I don't care
column28: I think this is awesome.  What this does is allow you to place whatever type of potions you have in your bags in the Auto-potion slot.  You can then click it "On" and choose a percentage of health in which to have it switch to.  I have mine at 30% and it has seriously helped.  This allows you to focus on the action (you'd just be clicking it anyways
column29: don't waste the global cooldown) while staying somewhat safe.  This does not gaurantee that you will stay alive.  This is not a 100% proof plan against death.  You can still die.  Don't kid yourself.  Some of the daily instances are just mean.  But this feature is just really awesome and I've never seen it before in any MMO.  That I remember.\n\nLots and lots to do.  You have cooking done in a unique fashion
column30: bring items you find randomly around the world to special cooks in the towns and they can help you fuse up something amazing.  Sometimes it's green
column31: sometimes it's orange and you will get an achievement and exp for doing so.  Sometimes it's purple and helps specifically with PvP!  There are thousands of hidden quests and achievements in every area of the game.  From finding green question marked items and finishing the tasks lined up with them
column32:
to gathering loyalty points that you can also use in the item mall for lots of really cool items without spending a single penny.  Or chase down the 4-6 unique monsters in each area and turn in their pots to the city/village jailer for extra goodies and more achievements/titles.

Everything on the UI can be moved anywhere you want it.

The UI itself is great looking and you can even shrink or enlarge all of the elements.

Lots of different ways of doing quests.  I have noticed some people saying it's the same as many other MMOs and there is a lot of grinding.  I don't think this is true at all.  Yes
column33: you kill enemies and you collect items but there is a LOT more than just that going on.  Sometimes you are dodging the eyes of the bad guys trying to get through a dungeon or winning over the baddy in order to help you later on.  Planting bombs
column35: sneaking through very dangerous areas.  There's more than just the normal amount of "kill this" and "collect that".  Plus
column36: it actually makes 100% sense as to WHY you are doing it.  it isn't just "my farm is in danger kill 5000 beetles".  You are killing those things and collecting those items in order to help finish a much bigger picture which I think is really cool.  The kill quests and collection items aren't over done either.  At most I have been asked to kill 10 things at one time.  Not a big deal to me at all.\n\nAuto join a guild
column37: get benefits and never be bothered.  Or bother them and start a conversation.  It's literally up to you.  I love this feature
column38:
I wish every game had something like this.

----------------------
Bad:

Not a lot of character slots available
column39: only three without paying.\n\nBots.  They aren't a huge deal and literally only sit in one place of each zone that I have noticed
column40: but it's really annoying.  They are always the guys with the big cannon looking things
column41: I can't remember the name of the class.  They all look the exactg same and have ridiculous names.  Just annoying.\n\nSometimes it is a little too easy.  You feel like you are just sweeping through everything.  This could be a good thing to some
column42: I don't see it that way though so am only naming it as a con.  I would like there to be much more challenge.  The daily instances offer something more
column43:
but only rarely and for the most part they aren't too hard either.

Bag space.  They will give you bags and stuff from time to time and all but really there isn't much at all.  Especially your bank.  It is TINY and I really hate that.  You have a shared bank which is awesome but it is just too small.

Cooking things requires far too much money.  I don't spend my money on much else really.  I get items from dungeons and such and don't want to spend it on AH crap or personal sellers.  But fusing together some cooked chicken costs much too much.

You share Eidolons with your account.  This can be good and bad."

reviewText:
A beautiful game!
Instead of putting a whole paragraph on how I love it, I'll just put some points down on what I really liked about it. I will also put some kind of not-so-great things here as well, so you can see if this is the game for you!

Pros:

1. The scenery itself is very beautiful! Each town and area has their own little thing and you can explore all of the beautiful sights!

2. The enemies are very adorable! Now this isn't much of a pro to the game since enemy style doesn't really tell how good a game is, but I thought to put it out there. I feel bad killing a lot of the enemies because of how cute they are.

3. There are 3 servers in a game. Each server is seperate so you can make 3 characters per server. In total, you can have 9 characters. I am a person that likes to try a lot of different classes, so this is great for me! If you're like that too, you'll love this! I know from my experience of different MMORPGs that a lot of games don't really allow this kind of thing. The only one I can remember was Fiesta online did this. I know there are a couple more out there that I don't remember. But this one does that kind of thing, so I think it's great!

4.  The character design for your character and the NPCs are so adorable! I really like the character customization on this game. While there isn't too much to the customization, it's enough to make nice characters, in my opionion! I wasn't expecting something like this to have PS2 Online super ultra customization, but I was surprised to how much there was in it. So overall, its a great player maker!

5. There are so many quests! Many of them are not fighting-based either, so you won't always be running around doing the same thing over and over again. You set up traps, deliver things, make things, etc. Of course, though, there will always be more fighting than, lets say, delivery quests. But, the small difference in routine gives it a little more fun! It even has a stroy questline to it as well!

6. You get an ostrich. That's right. You get to ride an ostrich. This also doesn't make a game 100% better, but I think it's pretty cool that your free mount is an ostrich.

7. Another thing I like about this game is it has such a friendly environment! Many times have I made a character and at a low-level, higher ups have me join their guild or party to help me out thinking I'm extremely new. I have not once gotten into an argument with anyone. The community is great in my opinion. I'm not sure if others would agree with me because everyone has their own experiences with other people in MMORPGs, but my experience has been good so far. I'm hoping it is like this for everyone!

8. You can get something called loyalty points" through out the game that you can use to "buy" costumes! Loyalty points are free
date: but a little difficult to get a lot. But if you're determined and do a lot of easedropping on NPCs
recommended: you'll rack up those loyalty points and get that cool costume you wanted! They also have another point system that you actually have to pay money to get
hoursPlayed:
but I think that it's great that the game developers let the people who don't pay money on games have a chance to get something cool!

---

Cons:

1. This game does get kind of repetitive. Even though they have different quests thats not all fighting
voteText: they are usually "get __ amount of __" kind of quests. My higher up is aroung level 36 if I remember
helpfulPercent: and it's getting a little boring aroung there. However I do sometimes continue to log on and play. They do have "fame quests" and "daily quests" that they put up if you don't feel like doing the same old quests. (<---maybe should have put that in pros?)\n\n2. It is a point-and-click stlyled fighting game. You do have hot keys for your abilities
votesHelpful: but for the most part
votesTotal: it's a point-and-click. If you're not a fan of that style of fighting in an MMORPG
votesFunny: then you'll probably get bored very fast.\n\n3. Laggy a bit. This might just be for me and my dumb computer. But if you have just a general computer or laptop
commentsCount: you may experience some lag (not too much of it unless you're in a crowded area
column16: but thats normal for every crowded MMORPG). The cutscenes don't work for me because of it. It may be different for you though! So don't stress over this point too much.\n\n4. Some quests require you have a party of 3. If you are a solo player like me
column17: that may serve a problem in trying to find and work the courage to work with people. There is a party finder so you can form parties for just the dungeon. However
column18: for me
column19: I like doing things alone and forming parties is awkward because then I have to figure out if I should leave the party or if they still want to work together
column20: etc. So if you're a solo player
column21: some of these moments might not be for you.\n\n5. Very easy. This could be a pro as well if you like things easy. Bosses are not that hard

reviewText:
Oh boy, where should i start?
This AMMOJRPG is fun and quite enjoyable game out of other AMMO imo so i'll put my positive and negatives and this is my review and my opinion but feel free to critcize me about what i put.
just note that EG means end game so keep that in mind

Pros:
- The story is interesting
- Several classes and a sub class at lvl 40
- Music is good
- Graphics is nice for the anime style for this game
- Flashy skill animations
- Tons of costumes to make your character fancy and kawaii
- A huge and highly active community that has veterans and new players
- Cool looking Eidolons
- Daily events that players can join in
- The world is amazing and detailed.
- Easy to get into but the controls can be tricky but you will get used to it eventually

Cons:
- The game reuses the same models for almost every npc and enemies and they just reskin them same with dungeons
- Some of the EG players can be extremely annoying and obnoxious for new players
- Farm bots which is very common in mmo's but the bots tend to lag the servers.
- PVP can be unfair when it comes down to upgraded gears most of the time
- Simple character creation(imo i like more complex character creation system)
- Barely enough gold to spend on stuff if you don't pay money(espicially End Game) due to inflation
- Some area's can cause frame rate drops and having a lot of players in a single area doing certain skills will also cause frame drops and may lead to the game crashing

In all honesty, the game can be fun for some people or it can be boring. The thing i hate the most is that almost every enemy has some sort of stun and almost every class has a stun or something similar of that type.  Even though i put the music in the pros, it can get annoying to listen to the same music over and over again so it's better if you just put up you own music after listening to the bgms a few times. About what i mentioned earlier about some items can't be obtain easily with the in-game cash you earn through missions and dungeons. I'm talking about costumes, fortification scrolls and refining materials if you're in a rush to get the strongest weapons. You have to do dungeons everytime when you have the entry points to go. The game also has a lot of pop culture references in the game so take note of that :

reviewText: I put around 30 hours into this game, i must say that it is fun for the first 40-50 levels and the levelling is quick, i would say too quick really, there is no tangible story line and some of the higher quests are not really suitable for a character of that level, for example, one of the lvl 40 quests is to go and collect some mushrooms. This ques gives you enough XP to almost hit lvl 41. The main attraction of the end game is the Sky Tower, where on the weekend you can form parties and take the tower floor by floor as the bosses get harder and harder. Never before have i had to grind so hard on an mmo, the content cap is around lvl 62 and the max level is 75 currently. Quests around this lvl tend to give you around %1 of the xp towards the next level. Dungeons are the way forward from this point. All in all, not a bad game but is still in development so take it as it is and enjoy.

reviewText:
I will rate this game on nthe basis of 3 different categories
1.Gameplay
2.Graphics
3.Enjoyment
1.Gameplay-9/10,
This game is a semi real time action/mmorpg game and for a semi real time game, the combat system is really fluid, it's also fairly simple and does not suffer from any bugs, it also helps that all the moves are enjoyable to look at.
2.Graphics-9/10-Great graphics, especially the anime art style, the models are all smooth and do not look weird, backgrounds are beautiful too, though needs better optimization.
3.Enjoyment-8.5/10, it is pretty simple to play and really enjoyable, quests dont feel like chores and fighting the mobs are always fun, but the games needs to promote more team play, it just seems boring playing alone and PVP needs to be improved.
Overall 9/10
If you are a fan of anime you will love this game.

reviewText:
An Anime style MMO that I really wish I knew about sooner.

I was surprised that when I gave this game a try (made a Scythe,) that it managed to pull me in very fast, with nothing but enjoyment. I haven't had an Anime style MMO do this to me in so long since Phantasy Star Online 2 when it was in Open Beta. I played Mabinogi for a solid two years, but I just lost any enjoyment I had with that game, because of how Pay to Win it was, along with how ignorant and elitist the Community is for all of Nexon's published Games.

However, even though this game did pull me in, and I have enjoyed the almost 80 hours I have put into it, it definitely does have some flaws (All MMOs have flaws.)

Pros:

-Classes: I took a look at what each of the classes do before I decided to start my journey, and while they all performed pretty well in what I have seen from Youtube, I decided to go with the Scythe, because I love Ranged DPS (This will also be a Con,) and I love that the Pets you summon give you benefits depending on which 3 of the 6 demons are summoned.  It's definitely crazy how high your Crit and Speed gets along the way, especially around level 55.
-Outfits: A lot of the outfits in this game are definitely what you would expect from an Anime-style MMO (Especially for Female characters, which I chose for my Scythe). I listed this as a Pro, because while you only get a certain amount of Costumes from doing the Main Storyline in each are, there are actually a lot of Outfits in this game that you can also get from other sources. There aren't that many Costumes on the Shop either, which is also a plus, because it isn't Pay to Dress up.
-Fishing: Yes, Fishing. The bane of every one's existence in pretty much every MMO. The one skill that will leave you bored for hours. Believe it or not, but in Aura Kingdom, Fishing is actually VERY useful, and profitable. As you fish, you can come across Fish in your inventory that when opened, can give EXP, Items for your Eidilons to feed them, Fusion materials for Orange quality Fishing Gear, Weapon Chests, and for some very odd reason, Costumes. Yes. You can get Costumes from Fishing. Most of them are not worth selling, but if you get the Custom variants (Orange,) you're going to easily pocket 50+ Gold just by selling it on the Auction House. Fishing is very profitable because you can sell the Costumes you get (low chance to get them though,) and you can open the Weapon Chests to get Weapons that you can sell to Vendors for about 100 - 200 silver (especially when you get the Level 60 Weapon Chests in the 60 areas. It's actually one of your two main sources for making income at Level 60+, unless you run the end game dungeons and get lucky on drops.
-Community: You don't know how incredibly hard it is for some one of my status to list the Community as a Pro for an MMO. I have been a part of the MMO Community since Everquest, and while every single one of them suffer from the typical cesspool players and elitists, Aura Kingdom so far has been very tame, and friendly. Other than the Dimensional Halls, I have not done any Party Dungeons at all while I was leveling, but every Dimensional Hall party I was in was just friendly in general.
-Soundtrack: While the Soundtrack itself does get repetitive quick in-game, and some times reused in different areas (especially for the Daily Fame / Emergency Quests,) it definitely has some that you will probably like. Candeo Core's Soundtrack is so far my favorite.
-Cash Shop: Other than Runescape's Cash Shop, and Phantasy Star Online 2's, this is one of the Cash Shops that contain VERY LITTLE Pay-to-win aspects to it. You can get Weapon / Armor Fortifications and Eidolons from the Cash Shop, but you will easily get Fortifications while questing, doing dungeons, or from doing the Dailies each and every day. The Eidolons on the other hand, is pretty much like Mabinogi's Gachapons. You have a chance to receive a certain Eidolon's Key in order to obtain them, or Fragments to combine a bunch later on into a Key. This isn't really Pay-to-Win because you can obtain Eidolons from doing the Eidolon Temple, Guild Hall, or Abyss / Otherworld dungeons when they reset.


Cons:

-Story: MMOs usually fall into one of two categories when it comes to Story. It either succeeds very well with it, and engages you, or you just want to hate it. Unfortunately, the Story in Aura Kingdom falls under this category. Other than the Tutorial area and Port Skandia, every Main Storyline in the rest of the areas is literally the same thing. This Town needs you to retrieve what was stolen. This town has a competition and needs you to help to get what you need. Alliances need to be formed. Yada yada. Pretty much when you are doing the quests in Aura Kingdom, you're better off just speeding through the Dialogue so you can get from one area to the next.
-Generic Quests: You know those Kill / Collect quests you LOVE so much from other MMOs, especially World of Warcraft? That's literally around 95% of the questing you will do. If the Anime Style of this Game, the Soundtrack, or the classes don't keep you in the game, this most certainly won't.
-Classes: But wait
date: Entro. You already put Classes in the Pros. Why is it in the Cons?" The main reason why is it also listed as a Con
recommended: is because of the Dungeon aspect. I will be blunt when I say this: At level 60+

reviewText:
I've been playing Aura for nearly eight hours and just can't stop!!
It's really a fantastic MMO RPG game with cute Anime-style character design, beautiful graphic, great weapon and costume system. The fusion and cast system are also worth trying!
The only disappointment to me is that there's almost no character voice. The dialogues are just silent with only the background music and gestures, making me a little bored after frequent readings. I hope that Aeria games can add voices to this game.
If you want to play it for fun, just choose the free version like I do. Sometimes, there're also official events that can grant you free but awesome stuff that deserves your attention.
If you want to get much deeper into the game, you need to pay for equipments, weapons and other stuff. However...REALLY EXPENSIVE...So think twice before throwing money into it.
Still, I strongly recommend this game to all players who love MMO.

reviewText:
Aura Kingdom, Colourful, bright and fun graphics.

This game feels and looks like an MMO but... you only need players to complete dungeons with you, the rest of the time you farm and farm and farm for more XP to level up. Once reached the required level you can start with dungeon, either play solo mode, party mode which is up to 3 players or Hellmode that requires at least 5 players.

Dungeon crawling is really fun to play with a friend or random people but people will not join your party to start the dungeon with you, so that means going back to farm XP again.

The game drags on with pointless quests and farming, farming can be very boring because there's no competition, you can farm solo and wont even need a party memeber.

I recommend this game for the fun gameplay, cool character creation and the ability to fly.
