reviewText:
In my experience this game is actually pretty good. The characters are cute, the combat system is straight forward, and the quests and auto-routing makes this game, basically play itself.

Now I'm not new to mmos, and I have played countless types of various styles and this one really caught my attention. What I like the most is that it's super easy to level up on your own, and you don't really have to rely on others. I've played other MMOs, where I simply couldn't progress on my own cause well, the character I made just wasn't fast/strong enough to gain the exp. Clerics suck, just saying but, I also can't play non-clerics/squishy characters.

I also like how, you don't have to work as hard to level up to get those cooler looking skills, or in other words, you get to get those cool skills at the get go. Cause that's a major selling point for me, I'm all about the graphics and how flashy and cool you get to make your character.

The edioleons are super cool, wish there was more of a way to pick which ones you get, or at least raise the chances of getting the one you want. If there is, well... I guess I haven't looked into it enough. But I'm also not the type to like grind for hours in the same dungeon to get something super rare however what I noticed from dungeoning it probably won't take too much time to get that shiny armour you want. Anyone willing to do that, super props to you. I never know how you do it.

Other cool features are the gliding, the duel class option at level 40, dungeons and auto-loot pick up are super useful and that there is a pretty extensive fishing option. Armour and Weapon fortification is pretty simple too, making anyone able to upgrade their stuff; takes a lot of resources, but it's still fun and you're not likely going to loose your stuff if it fails. All of these I find super awesome cause these are stuff I wish was found in other games.

TL;DR for pros:
super easy to play on your own, has everything you can want in a game that you probably wouldn't have thought of. I barely scratched the surface of this game, and I bet it's even better when you dig deeper.

Now what I don't like, and I don't know if this is just me, but I have played this game with a friend, and even though we were both playing the game, it didn't really feel like we played together. We were both just running about on our own, and talking in between when we were stuck. I'm super social when it comes to ♥♥♥♥♥♥mes, but the fact that there isn't the shared loot pickup for quests, or that exp isn't shared between us, it really feels like a solo game. The best you can do is just stand around and kill stuff while waiting for your friend. And a lot of the quests are specifically solo anyways.

What also bothered me is the mouse controls. You get used to them as you play (not really) but the two camera functions can really hinder you in a bind. Like one camera simply rotates around your character, and the other one actually makes your character turn with it. So like I know during boss fights, I turn my camera a lot to look at different angles, but I don't nessecarily need my character to be turnt around too cause some skills require them to be facing a monster. So with that, sometimes I would need to run away to get out of a red zone, and I find myself using the wrong camera move, and I just have my character running backwards super slowly, and usually on the verge of death now. (I'm not the type to click-to-move) And some mobs jump around a lot so you need that camera moving.

And another is the skill keys hot-bar. There are waaaay too many skills to fit on one hot bar and it's inconvient how they only go up to 8. I used to it going up to the =" key. Plus with the eidoleon skills
recommended: glide features and other stuff I can't remember
hoursPlayed: you are't left with a lot of space
voteText:
especially when the second class comes into play. So you're left with like maybe 4 of your favourite skills from each class.

TL;DR for the cons:
It doesn't feel as social of a game going by my standards. There isn't that sense of playing with friends
helpfulPercent:
but just having them on the side (but thats not too bad). The mouse controls are super annoying and the hot-bars don't have enough space and can get pretty cluttered.

Overall:
I would totally recommend. There's a lot I complained about
votesHelpful: but really they don't affect gameplay that much. If you know what you're doing it's pretty meaningless.\n\n10/10"

reviewText:
I will rate this game on nthe basis of 3 different categories
1.Gameplay
2.Graphics
3.Enjoyment
1.Gameplay-9/10,
This game is a semi real time action/mmorpg game and for a semi real time game, the combat system is really fluid, it's also fairly simple and does not suffer from any bugs, it also helps that all the moves are enjoyable to look at.
2.Graphics-9/10-Great graphics, especially the anime art style, the models are all smooth and do not look weird, backgrounds are beautiful too, though needs better optimization.
3.Enjoyment-8.5/10, it is pretty simple to play and really enjoyable, quests dont feel like chores and fighting the mobs are always fun, but the games needs to promote more team play, it just seems boring playing alone and PVP needs to be improved.
Overall 9/10
If you are a fan of anime you will love this game.

reviewText:
An Anime style MMO that I really wish I knew about sooner.

I was surprised that when I gave this game a try (made a Scythe,) that it managed to pull me in very fast, with nothing but enjoyment. I haven't had an Anime style MMO do this to me in so long since Phantasy Star Online 2 when it was in Open Beta. I played Mabinogi for a solid two years, but I just lost any enjoyment I had with that game, because of how Pay to Win it was, along with how ignorant and elitist the Community is for all of Nexon's published Games.

However, even though this game did pull me in, and I have enjoyed the almost 80 hours I have put into it, it definitely does have some flaws (All MMOs have flaws.)

Pros:

-Classes: I took a look at what each of the classes do before I decided to start my journey, and while they all performed pretty well in what I have seen from Youtube, I decided to go with the Scythe, because I love Ranged DPS (This will also be a Con,) and I love that the Pets you summon give you benefits depending on which 3 of the 6 demons are summoned.  It's definitely crazy how high your Crit and Speed gets along the way, especially around level 55.
-Outfits: A lot of the outfits in this game are definitely what you would expect from an Anime-style MMO (Especially for Female characters, which I chose for my Scythe). I listed this as a Pro, because while you only get a certain amount of Costumes from doing the Main Storyline in each are, there are actually a lot of Outfits in this game that you can also get from other sources. There aren't that many Costumes on the Shop either, which is also a plus, because it isn't Pay to Dress up.
-Fishing: Yes, Fishing. The bane of every one's existence in pretty much every MMO. The one skill that will leave you bored for hours. Believe it or not, but in Aura Kingdom, Fishing is actually VERY useful, and profitable. As you fish, you can come across Fish in your inventory that when opened, can give EXP, Items for your Eidilons to feed them, Fusion materials for Orange quality Fishing Gear, Weapon Chests, and for some very odd reason, Costumes. Yes. You can get Costumes from Fishing. Most of them are not worth selling, but if you get the Custom variants (Orange,) you're going to easily pocket 50+ Gold just by selling it on the Auction House. Fishing is very profitable because you can sell the Costumes you get (low chance to get them though,) and you can open the Weapon Chests to get Weapons that you can sell to Vendors for about 100 - 200 silver (especially when you get the Level 60 Weapon Chests in the 60 areas. It's actually one of your two main sources for making income at Level 60+, unless you run the end game dungeons and get lucky on drops.
-Community: You don't know how incredibly hard it is for some one of my status to list the Community as a Pro for an MMO. I have been a part of the MMO Community since Everquest, and while every single one of them suffer from the typical cesspool players and elitists, Aura Kingdom so far has been very tame, and friendly. Other than the Dimensional Halls, I have not done any Party Dungeons at all while I was leveling, but every Dimensional Hall party I was in was just friendly in general.
-Soundtrack: While the Soundtrack itself does get repetitive quick in-game, and some times reused in different areas (especially for the Daily Fame / Emergency Quests,) it definitely has some that you will probably like. Candeo Core's Soundtrack is so far my favorite.
-Cash Shop: Other than Runescape's Cash Shop, and Phantasy Star Online 2's, this is one of the Cash Shops that contain VERY LITTLE Pay-to-win aspects to it. You can get Weapon / Armor Fortifications and Eidolons from the Cash Shop, but you will easily get Fortifications while questing, doing dungeons, or from doing the Dailies each and every day. The Eidolons on the other hand, is pretty much like Mabinogi's Gachapons. You have a chance to receive a certain Eidolon's Key in order to obtain them, or Fragments to combine a bunch later on into a Key. This isn't really Pay-to-Win because you can obtain Eidolons from doing the Eidolon Temple, Guild Hall, or Abyss / Otherworld dungeons when they reset.


Cons:

-Story: MMOs usually fall into one of two categories when it comes to Story. It either succeeds very well with it, and engages you, or you just want to hate it. Unfortunately, the Story in Aura Kingdom falls under this category. Other than the Tutorial area and Port Skandia, every Main Storyline in the rest of the areas is literally the same thing. This Town needs you to retrieve what was stolen. This town has a competition and needs you to help to get what you need. Alliances need to be formed. Yada yada. Pretty much when you are doing the quests in Aura Kingdom, you're better off just speeding through the Dialogue so you can get from one area to the next.
-Generic Quests: You know those Kill / Collect quests you LOVE so much from other MMOs, especially World of Warcraft? That's literally around 95% of the questing you will do. If the Anime Style of this Game, the Soundtrack, or the classes don't keep you in the game, this most certainly won't.
-Classes: But wait

reviewText:
I've been playing Aura for nearly eight hours and just can't stop!!
It's really a fantastic MMO RPG game with cute Anime-style character design, beautiful graphic, great weapon and costume system. The fusion and cast system are also worth trying!
The only disappointment to me is that there's almost no character voice. The dialogues are just silent with only the background music and gestures, making me a little bored after frequent readings. I hope that Aeria games can add voices to this game.
If you want to play it for fun, just choose the free version like I do. Sometimes, there're also official events that can grant you free but awesome stuff that deserves your attention.
If you want to get much deeper into the game, you need to pay for equipments, weapons and other stuff. However...REALLY EXPENSIVE...So think twice before throwing money into it.
Still, I strongly recommend this game to all players who love MMO.

reviewText:
Level 1: Kill X of Y. Alright, standard fare for a MMO that isn't FFXI.
Level 2: Click these mushrooms right next to you. Alright.
Level 3: Kill A of B. Maybe it's just a long tutorial. No one shares credit in the party.
Level 4: Find these relics that are right beside you and collect them. Okay.
Level 5: Here's a mount that goes slower than your walking speed. Fantastic.
Level 6: Kill this instanced mob that you can't kill with your party.
Level 7. Find the heavy boxes that might just be right beside you. You need 5, luckily there's 20 and they respawn in 4 seconds.
Level 8: ♥♥♥♥ you.

reviewText:
General GameplayAura Kingdom can be a little grindy but in the end it's fun and easy to get most of the stuff, specially if you play with friends.

The story is interesting but a little childish and predictable.

Gameplay Rating: 4/5

EngineGamebryo

Graphics Options
The game has a good set of graphics options.

Graphics Quality
The graphics are cel shaded, anime like, makes it all more interesting and different from the standard.

Performance
The engine doesn't take advantage of modern hardware, and suffers because of that.

Engine Rating: 3/5

Overall Rating: 7/10

NotesOverall rating is a combination of the gameplay (mechanics and story) and engine (how the game looks and runs). If you disagree with my take on the game or if something is factually incorrect, please leave a comment below!

reviewText:
I love this game, I think it's so fun. I'll admit, after you play 30+ hours the game can get a little repetitive (Go here, kill this amount of these), but that doesn't stop me from coming back and playing it more. I love the customization, and I think the anime style is very cute. I personally prefer PvE, so I don't know much about PvP in this game. But, I can tell you the PvE is very fun and will have you hooked.

The quest line is good. There's always something for you to do, from any level. I have kept mostly to the main quest line, but I've done a side quest here and there (though personally I have found that you dont really need to do them, as your level should stay consistent with the difficulty).

Overall I really like this game, and would give it a 9/10 (minus one star because of the repetition).

reviewText: At first, I really liked Aura Kingdom. It's bright, colorful, has very engaging combat, and is, just in general, fun.... but only for the first two levels (Or 'locations.') Later in the game, you start to wonder What the hell am I doing and what does any of this have to do with the story?" This will happen A LOT.\n\nHere's an example from one of the earlier quests where such an instance first appears. You need to make medicen for your character because he/she passed out. Well
recommended: fine. But you need to kill six of the giant creatures for their blood. WHAT THE HELL? HOW MUCH BLOOD DOES THIS DOCTOR NEED FOR LITTLE OL' ME?!\n\nThis is fine in those quests where the particular creature you're killing needs to be driven out of the area
hoursPlayed: but when you need to collect items from them? It's VERY monotonous. Another reason this sucks is that
voteText: when you're collecting items from creatures
helpfulPercent: there is a 20% chance that you will actually get the item you need. As a rough estimate
votesHelpful: if you have to kill 4 fish to get scales
votesTotal: you'll probably have to kill 8 fish to get the four sets of scales. This becomes even worse when
votesFunny: in higher level areas
commentsCount: you have to kill 7 and 14 creatures to gather the specified number of itmes you need to complete a "Main Quest" that doesn't seem to have anything to do with the story. This makes playing the game the way your suppose to a chore.\n\nAnother problem this game has is its dungeons. These are usually big cave-like areas where you fight large waves of monsters. Most Dungeons require the player to be in a party of three to actually activate it. This would be fine if players in this game were actually considerate. No one wants anything to do with you unless you wear expensive costumes and hats
column16: or have the best mounts and weapons. It's like
column17: if Team Fortress 2 met World of Warcraft in a very ill-considerate and rude way. This is most evident
column18: unfortunatly
column19: for players who speak english. My first language is english and my spanish is a little rusty (But little to no spanish speaking players play this game anyway) meaning I am stuck dealing with the ruder end of the player pool
column20: which is the dominant end. The worst part is these dungeons are REQUIRED to finish the story. Which means you could be stuck for a LONG time on the same main quest
column21: not because you cannot defeat the enemies because they
column24: but because no one wants to join you. Making friends in this game is hard for the same reason
column25: even if the player is a noob at the same time you are and has the first constume as well.\n\nIn all
column26: Aura Kingdom is a game with lovely visuals

reviewText:
Level 1: Kill X of Y. Alright, standard fare for a MMO that isn't FFXI.
Level 2: Click these mushrooms right next to you. Alright.
Level 3: Kill A of B. Maybe it's just a long tutorial. No one shares credit in the party.
Level 4: Find these relics that are right beside you and collect them. Okay.
Level 5: Here's a mount that goes slower than your walking speed. Fantastic.
Level 6: Kill this instanced mob that you can't kill with your party.
Level 7. Find the heavy boxes that might just be right beside you. You need 5, luckily there's 20 and they respawn in 4 seconds.
Level 8: ♥♥♥♥ you.

reviewText: Possibly the greatest anime-centric free-to-play MMORPG around, Aura Kingdom provides players with active and innovative gameplay, but suffers in the playerbase aspect. As many reviews state, there are MANY MANY MANY bots roaming the world of AK. However, if you manage to find yourself a member of a decent guild, you'll have a much better time with regards to social interaction. Combat customization is highly varied - customize your character to suite your playstyle. With 11 classes to choose from and the option of a second, there's enough variation to keep anyone entertained when combating the various bosses found within the plethora of dungeons.

reviewText:
Personally, I am loving this game. Reasons for the positives are:

Very nice scenery, whether at high setting or low, this game still shines out on top.
The characters are very kawaiii! Just make you want to hug'em. <3
The point's tree for character upgrade is very simple and straight-forward and is very uniquw in terms of different classes needing different points in their skills.
Very nice weapons (personal favourite)
A very nice community as well, everyone is working together and there isn't very much arguing.

Negatives for this game. ):
Every game has it's negatives, but this fortunately has very little:

Eventhough leveling is straightforward, it does take AGGGGEEESS to level up.
Quests are very generic, such as Kill this many ...."
The story isn't that in-depth
recommended:
you don't get to know you're character as much and it gets very boring.


Overall rating: 9/10
Concluding from all this
hoursPlayed: I will still enjoy this game and eventhough there are a couple of negatives about this game
voteText: they are made up by the enjoyment of the game."

reviewText: Product received for free\n\nWhat a great game. The grafix and clothing design are sick, but you have to spend money to get it like all the great mounts and extra clothing (so that sucks).  The battlegrounds are a waste to even try, you will just get ♥♥♥♥♥ even with full pvp gear. If you are lvl 50 they will still put you up with lvl 70 players they all one hit you, so its a shamefull 15min, its die spawn repeat or you just wait out the time and cant do anything.  This game you have to have lots of friends or you wont be able to do any party runs at your level, very hard getting people randomly to join you. For a anima fan the clothing you get visually makes this great eye candy and the spells and attacks animation are very well done. Overal not bad game but you will have to spend to look great and you need friends who can play with you at the same time lines. The worst part about this game is the timing of events, like the tower that only opens at certain times, if you cant be online you will never be able to do them.

reviewText:
Hello, in this review, you will find every little detail you need to know about this game.

So basically, you create your own warrior, and you complete quests throughout the game. I personally love leveling up, but i wish i can make some friends :(

Okay, so what you need to know :


This game is, of course, an MMORPG. You create your player with a selection of 12 classes. After you selected your character features, you have to choose your eidolon. Eidolons are basically partners that stay with you on your journey ( Pokemon-ish lol ). You begin the game in a dimensional belt or something. You fight your way to the boss. Somehow you end up in a small town next to the ocean. You have to complete some tasks for the people. After this, you move on to the next area, then the next and so on. The max level is 80 I believe, and once you reach over 70, your level turns into ??. I've been playing for a long time, and honestly, I love this game so much. If you would like to meet me in-game go ahead, but ofc you would have to be my friend, or if you already are, well you get the point.

Okay well I hope this helped. And yes, I recommend this game DONT ASK ME QUESTIONS STEAM MY GOSH.......

Sorry steam was asking me if i recommend this game. Well bye bye!

It's kind of hard to list pros and cons since this game never ends. But everything for this game on a scale from 1-10, I say this game rates a 7. I'm very addicted to it.. Lol

reviewText: There is abolutely too much grinding. I understand that this is an MMORPG, but there is too much grinding and fetch quests. Many of these fetch quests are extremely random, are of no importance, and ruin the game. Aside from that, the game looks and sounds great. I was truly dissapointed that the actual game was not fun. This game has so much potential, all of which was thrown out the door. I think that they realized that there wasn't enough substance when they added a button that brought you exactly where you needed to go to do exactly what you needed to do. I just spammed that button after trying to have fun.

reviewText: The greatest MMORPG ive ever played, got me hooked faster than WoW did back in the day
voteText: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Ok, so I can agree. This game has a good fantasy feeling to it, unlike other MMORPGs that just make you bored in 5 minutes of gameplay. The game classes contain some awesome gear and interesting spells, especially when you're the new class.

Here are my GOOD sides and my BAD sides:

GOOD:
1. Class selection is wide ranged, unlike other MMORPGs.
2. Recieving free gifts each day and a free eidelon (an in-game pet for starters).
3. Friendly players who communicate kindly (most other MMORPGs aren't like this due to ragers and racism).
4. The new class is awesomely epic (sorry if awesomely isn't an existing word)
5. Good gameplay to make a good hour of footage/streaming on.
6. I've always wanted to see a good fantasy RPG that is like Perfect Worlds but got a better aspect to the gameplay.
7. The review rating is very positive which means new players every minute.
8. Noobies get a good teaching tutorial unlike others where they babble on forever.
9. Last but not least, fantastic graphics and music.

BAD:
1. Unable to switch what gender the class is (most RPGs allow you to do this, make this an update please).
2. Some people tend to break all the dungeons which usually crash the game servers. This means that people can't join       fast enough and sometimes can't join at all if they have a bad computer.
3. Some advanced players will try to 'help' you in to levelling, instead, all they do is leave you in a high level place and you die. This can be annoying because these players are able to persuade with such good passion that loads of players usually get tricked into it and this CAAAN be pretty rageful towards those type of players...
4. You know what I'm going to say, don't you? The graphics. Sometimes the graphics ARE a bit too powerful for some computers. I usually get gigantic lag spikes but at least I don't freeze like I've been saying with some players.
5. Some attacking animations are broken. Bad computers usually make the game crash. I've only had one crash for when I was in a guild dungeon raid and I was attempting to use my sorcerer skill which kind of crashed out my game because the attacking animation was broken. This is usually caused when the creator hasn't been bothered or forget to add an actual animation to that specific skill.
6. Finally, FIX THE SERVERS!!! I'm sick of people messaging my on Steam about how the Aura Kingdom servers are not working and it's all cause of me just because I used this special software to boost up my Aura Kingdom. I message them back saying It's not my fault the servers ain't working. The software doesn't even affect the servers on Aura Kingdom so stop blaming it on me because it will most likely be a person scamming or exploiting the servers out".

Like
date: I know Aura Kingdom can't help all these problems due to the game is gettin really popular and sooo many people are trying to join at once-especially at night. Now
recommended: I'm never going to stop playing Aura Kingdom due to these problems (I'm going to have to write this quickly because I have a guild dungeon in like 7 minutes and I don't want to miss it because if I do
hoursPlayed:
I'll be kicked out the guild).

-

reviewText:
This is a reivew based on a playthrough up to level 51 and including all side activities up to that point.

Aura Kingdom is an MMORPG that really follows pretty much all the standard tropes and doesnt bring a whole lot of new things to the table. 90% of the main quest is kill 14 x. Interestingly enough the daily quests, side quests and hidden quests tend to be where something other than kill 14 x happens. You have your standard activities, like collecting flowers, fishing, smithing and mining, however you can only get better at fishing and smithing.
The combat is the usual click on an enemy and let there be skills. You are much more mobile while doing so than in most MMORPGs however, only stopping for a second and not loading up the skill while standing frozen in place.
The class system is one of the unique parts of this game.
Not only is there a lot of different classes but you can actually have 2 classes from lvl 40 on. The second class will be heavyly nerfed compared to it being your first class but you can still use all the skills. Some class combinations grant bonus skills. Now this doesnt seem like much, but there is also the character custumization, masterys, the envo path and all together you can get rather creative. THe best part is that you can reset anything at any time for a small amount of ingame money. So you were a guy that runs around with 2 pistols and occasionaly gets out a sword, that skilled on critical damage and defense and preferred stun abilities etc.? Forget all that you are now a mage that wips out a scythe when he fgeels like it and commands a little demon army. If you get the hangt of it class switching can be a matter of minutes, so basically you are any class at any time throughout the entire game.

The second unique part is the Eidolon system. Eidolons are basically a constant follower and can be upgraded almost as much as yourself. Each comes with its own set of skills, and one liners. You get a small amount from the story of the game, however getting the others involves a LOT of work.

Another interesting thing is how casual the experience is. There is ALWAYS at least one main quest, so you always know where to go and what to do next. And the main quest will also be fitting for your level. Particularly in the early levels the speed at which you level up through main quests is insane. However, as said before it is usually kill 14 x.

The story itself is nothing worth mentioning, sure they wrote a lot and created so many characters and quests and whatever, but they mostly lack uniqueness and feel bland, basically you will find yourself skipping through all the dialogue at some point most likely, because it is so damn boring.

There is no faction system, which can be a good thing, as it doesnt split the playerbase.

The music is just as average as the story.

The graphics are nothing special either. Certain skills can look pretty but thats about it. The anime style of your character and most of the screenshots isnt really all that noticable.

The camera can be a gigantic issue at times when you go full in zoom and cant see anything because the game decided so.

Noticable is also  the small size of each map as well the speed at which you travel between maps. You will NEVER need more than 5 minutes to get anywhere. Quests will never take all that long and neither will dugeons. Alltogether this means that this is the one MMORPG where you can actually just fire it up for 20 mins and leave again and achieve something in the time.

What about p2w? Well obviously I dont know about endgame content but so far there was never even a slight need for money, nor people dominating me because of money, so yeah I'd dare to say no p2w.

Summed up: why did I give a positive rating? Because while it is so god damn average, it uses mechanics that have worked for decades now and is by no means a bad game. Also it is free, and for that price you dont get robbed of your money.

reviewText:
Product received for free

Looking for a game close enought ot SAO?

Well you've come to the right place, cause Aura Kingdom is only one of those anime themed MMORPGs that is as close to SAO...

Grindy, but worth it. Lots of players (Especially on channel 1 of your chosen server) and a very active community. Weapons are very stylish, but the costume is hard to come by without advancing to get at least a decent Forest Ambassador outfit. There is a currency called Loyalty Points (Accumulated by doing certain daily quests, returning monster bounties, or in valuable chests) and if you continuously do these quests, getting a costume without abiding to microtransaction's tempting offers for the best looking costumes, can be pretty satisfying, include the mounts too which are kinda affordable. Eidolons, the pets which is already registered in your account and can be used by multiple characters depending if they are active on the other character, is very convenient as you won't be grinding hard again if you decide to create a 2nd character, but instead the keys 9which are used to summon them) can be saved to do an evolution for your eidolon. And lastly, I would like to commend the very interesting and versatile sub skill system. In lvl 40, you will be given a quest where you can pick your sub, but worry not, as your sub can be replaced for free!

Overall, I would recommend this to anyone who likes MMORPGs with anime theme and an active community and fun to play dungeons.

reviewText:
Overall this is an awesome game!

It has a slight learning curve with some of the aspects of the game, but once you get it down it's a lot of fun. You're able to create some cute and colorful characters, the one fall-back with the character creation is the lack of variety. You can pick between 9 faces and 10 hairstyles 12 hair colors and 4 skin tones. This is not really a SMALL amount, until you're in game and notice how many other characters that your same hair style. But the combos they have are very nice and very well done. I would love to see them expand on this in the future.

It is one of those games that you click on the quest and your character starts running to it, making getting to and from your quest spots a breeze, almost too easy. But the combat system is really impressive and has some great animation work. You should put thought into how you're going to build up your character before you start adding attruibute points here or there. You can do a google search on some of the classes and get builds and guides on how to create and lvl your characters. Failure to fo this way will make you find yourself spending a lot of in game currency to reset your stats.

In short, just download the game and jump in feet first....

reviewText:
A very interesting Game thats for sure. It's a you either like it or hate it.
Very Familiar to Perfect World Int. style of Travel and crafting.
It took me about a week to start figuring stuff out but once you do its like activate all engines!
Im lvl 50 so here are some of my thoughts on it so far:

-Very flashy fighting and easy as heck to learn.
-THE MASSIVE amout of pop culure refrencing in this game is halarious everything from David Bowie to Romeo and Juliet
and everything in between. the David Bowie movie refrence to Dance Magic Dance song made my day. power of the vodoo.
-Super Mind numbing easy traveling. click and auto path is pretty dam good compared to PFI.
- personal Stall so you can sell unwanted stuff or Auction House it.
-Really cool looking Weapons and outfits.

My irks about the game:
INVISIBLE WALLS omg why does this still exist x_X really annoying sometimes when you GLIDE.
BOTS BOTS BOTS BOTS!!!! but suprisling not alot of gold spammers theres a few but thats to be in any game.
HACKERS / BUG abuser before Maintenance is FREAKING nightmare so I usally log off 1 hr before and no issues now.
very very grindy... the biggest issues is Quest that make you kill 14 of this 14 of that to make you go back and collect 14 of what the mob drops AFTER you just killedc them.

But aside all that its not a bad game if your an Anime fan or flashy combat and easy to learn combat.
the crafting/Refining is a bit rought to learn but once you do its makes a HUGE diffrence in gameplay.
DUNGEONS are freaking awesome!! but getting groups 2gether is a bit of a pain if your not in right Timezone server.

What I really like is the AUTO pathing to Quest - click and AUTOdrive is great if you dont have time to sit around looking for NPC for Quest. and a journal on the side incase you lose or cant find one is super easy just click and go! :D

Guilds are freaking handy as hell if you find a decent one that helps you understand the game if your serious.

my Score: 7.5 out 0f 10  (as an Anime fan)
6 out of 10 as Casual gamer.

reviewText:
Less than two minutes into the game, I am given the option of having a dragon companion.

Fifteen minutes in, I've acquired a shy ostrich as my noble steed. I've also learned to fly through the air, beaten two world bosses, and gotten a variety of Unique equipment for when I'm a higher level.

Aura Kingdoms has a cute, and surprisingly deep, story. You're an 'Envoy of Gaia', blessed with a mysterious power to summon and harness pokemon- sorry, Eidolons. The host of characters all have thriving, quirky personalities. It's cliche (exactly what you would expect from an anime-themed game), but it works.

Controls are finicky, and no where near as fluid as they could be: these sort of refinements however take time.

There is no pay-to-win aspect that usually comes from F2P MMOs - cash-shop items all have an equivalent which can be purchased with 'loyalty' points - points you get from earning achievements, grouping with friends or greeting players. The cash shop exclusive items are cosmetic only (for example, a unicorn versus its loyalty-point equivalent: a horse-drawn carriage).

It's a game I'd recommend to any guy wanting to get his girlfriend into games, or the otakus among you. Give it fifteen minutes. You'll be pleasantly surprised. It's casual. It's cute. It has dragons.

reviewText:
Its a good game, just not for any hardcore mmo players:


I have played This before it came out on steam so here are some things that i think should be noted
Pros:

No mana for an MMORPG

Coolown is fast and you have a lot of skills at a low level

wont feel the urge of buying anything until finishing the main quests/ lvl 30 up

good for Casual players starting to get in to MMORPG's

It's a free game

Cute Dresses and costumes, yes this is a pro

you can mount a unicorn, ostrich, dragon, Cindirella's pumpkin wagon etc etc

you get free pets and you get a free pet at the start ( Although you cant use it until lvl 10+)

combat system is fairly simple to understand

IN THE MIDDLE (CAN BE PROS OR CONS)

Art style, I enjoy anime, but im not sure with everyone else

lolis are abundant in the game

you CAN solo most of the quests except for the ones that are mandatory to have a team mate up until lvl 45+, not sure about the quests above that

There is a system in the game that automatically puts you in a route to a selected quest.

CONS;

Although the combat system is simple, and the cooldown are fast, i often see myself using the same skills over and over again

Pretty grindy after you reach lvl 20+, there are grind quests on levels lower than 20, but you will start to feel the repetativeness in lvl 20

although there is a currency that the game gives away, the bulk of the cash grab is on things that upgrade armor and weapons.

About that mount thing, most of those you'll need to buy, that includes the unicorn, but not the ostrich, you get a free ostrich.

reviewText:
Fun anime-based MMO; not overly complicated, and easy to learn.

Pros:
Flashy moves!
Scantily-clad anime-chicks!
The ability to skip useless quest-dialogue!
You can fly!

Cons:
Horrendous server stability.
Overly goofy Asian-MMO crafting/upgrading system.
You can fly (but there are MILLIONS of mid-air invisible walls blocking obvious flight paths)!

All in all, a great free-to-play game, that seems to just utilize it's item mall for character decoration, which is A-OK.  Now, with it's server instability, and it's awkward crafting/upgrading, it suits being a free-to-play game, as paying for the game would denote much better server maintenance.

Quick Edit:  To discuss the crafting system a bit more, it seems a lot of the F2P Asian-based MMO's nowadays seem to not want to tread on eachother's crafting systems, each new MMO coming up with a more awkward and less sensical way to craft and upgrade gear than the last.  Not a terribly bad thing, but worthy of note.
